Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, ladrillo, arena y lámina para la galera que también necesita cambio.
texts.en: María, 48 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and 5 children (ages 11, 18, 21, 25 and 29). María works selling chickens at the central market in her area. Every day she gets up very early for work. María is requesting this loan from FUSAI to rebuild the sink that holds the water since it has deteriorated. With the requested amount she will buy cement, brick, sand, as well as sheet metal for the chicken coop, which also needs to be replaced.

loans.use: to purchase cement, brick, sand and sheet metal to build a sink.

loans.name: Mubashira

texts.ru: Мубашира родилась в 1986 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Мубашира окончила Медицинский колледж, и данное время работает в местной больнице медсестрой. Мубашира выполняет свою работу качественно. Мубашира имеет большое горе. Ее сын серьёзно болен. Ему необходимо лечится. Мубашира не имеет денег, чтобы купить лекарства для лечения сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки лекарства. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mubashira was born in 1986. She is married and is raising three children. Mubashira completed Medical College, and currently works in a local hospital as a nurse. Mubashira fulfills her job with quality.

Mubashira has heartbreak. Her son is seriously ill. He needs medicine. Mubashira does not have money, to buy medicine for her son's treatment. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to purchase medicine.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the treatment of her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, beans, and cooking utensil for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more children clothes for her business.

loans.name: Elyse Marie Lydie

texts.fr:
Madame ELYSE MARIE LYDIE  est célibataire sans enfant.
Elle est étudiante  en classe de licence III  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  03ans. 
Madame veut financer ses études supérieures.
 Après les  études, elle souhaite travailler dans une entreprise et avoir une famille comblée avec 03 enfants.
texts.en: Ms. ELYSE MARIE LYDIE is unmarried and no children. For three years, she has been a student at the ESTPO (advanced school for public works in Ouagadougou) and is in the Bachelor's Degree III class. She wants to finance her higher education. Upon graduating, she would like to work in a private company and have a family complete with three children.

loans.use: to finance her higher education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Yedi Nkonim Group

texts.en:
These three people are part of a group called "Yedi Nkonim" that was established in February, 2011. It is made up of members who are on very good terms. There is a good complicity among them, and they really stand together. Their main business is the retail of commodities, such as slippers, Gari (cassava flour), drinks, millet, and maize. They need 4,700 GHS in total.
 
Nafisatu is the woman standing left in the photograph. She is 43 years old, married, and mother of two boys. Her business consists of selling maize. She intends to buy one big bag of maize with 900 GHS, which could fetch her a profit of 150 GHS in two weeks. She will use her profits to bolster her savings and help her husband cover the expenses of the household (children's education and food).

loans.use: to buy one big bag of maize and resell to customers.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Isatu from Waterloo, western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has six children. She started her business to take care of her family and empower herself. 

Isatu runs a retails business selling palm oil. She has been running this business for six years. She works at the business 12 hours per day throughout the week. Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network within her operation area.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children. Mariatu established her retail business because she wants to create income to empower herself. She works at the business 7 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava grain (foofoo) to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay school fees for her children and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava grain (foofoo) to expand her business.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Abibatu from Waterloo, western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has five children. Abibatu established her charcoal business because she wants to create income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Abibatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business

loans.name: Nozilsho

texts.ru: Нозилшо 57 лет. Он работает в частной животноводческой ферме в своем районе Яван и имеет хороший опыт по выращиванию скотов. Нозилшо женат, имеет троих сыновей. В данный момент Нозилшо решил у себя дома открыть собственный бизнес по выращиванию крупнорогатого скота для дальнейшей продажи. Ему в этой деятельности будет помогать один сын. Нозилшо просит кредит в размере 3000 долларов, чтобы начать бизнес. Его собственый начальный капитал составляет почти 800 долларов США. Нозилшо на сумму кредита и сбережения планирует купить 5 голов крупнорогатого скота. У него имеются все условия для ведения данного бизнеса. Он надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Nozilsho is 57 years old.  He works at a private animal husbandry farm in his district of Yavan and has good experience in raising livestock.  Nozilsho is married and has three sons.  At the present time, Nozilsho decided to open his own business in raising cattle at home for subsequent resale.  One of his sons will be helping him with this business.  Nozilsho is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 dollars to start this business.  His own initial capital amounts to almost 800 US dollars.  Nozilsho plans to use the loan and his savings to buy five heads of cattle.  He has all of the necessary conditions for running this business.  He hopes for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy five heads of cattle and start his own business

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando vive con su  papa y su mama en la ciudad de Curuguaty, trabaja  y está cursando el 3° año de la carrera de Administración Rural y comenta que su sueño es llegar a ser reconocido por su talento y responsabilidad. 
Su madre es su fortaleza, y también dice que estudiar es caro, más aún si son de escasos recursos económicos por lo tanto trabajar de manera honrada es lo que hace para cubrir los gastos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y cubrir sus gastos de manutención, como ser copias y algunos materiales extras.
texts.en:
Armando lives with his father and mother in the city of Curuguaty. He is working and completing his third year toward a degree in Rural Administration. Armando says that his dream is to be recognized for his talent and his responsibility.

His mother is his strength. Armando also says that school is expensive, even more when one comes from a background with limited financial resources. For this reason, he works to make an honest living so that he can cover his expenses.

Armando is requesting this loan so that he can pay his tuition installments and cover his living expenses, such as making copies and obtaining a few material extras.

loans.use: to pay his tuition installments and cover his living expenses

loans.name: Elmurod

texts.ru: Элмурод 40-летний житель района Гиссар, занимается скотоводством. Он выращивает обычно молодых бычков и после месяца откорма продает на скотном рынке по прибыльной цене. Элмурод занимается этим бизнесом более 7 лет. Ему нравится его работа. Элмурод женат, имеет четверых детей. Он единственный добытчик в семье и доход с животноводства является единственным источником дохода семьи. Сейчас Элмуроду необходимо увеличить поголовья скота. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом для купли несколько голов молодых бычков.
texts.en: Elmurod is a 40 year-old resident of the Gissar district, involved in animal husbandry.  He generally raises young bulls and after a month of fattening up, sells them at a livestock market for a profitable price.  Elmurod has been involved in this business for over 7 years.  He likes his work.  Elmurod is married and has four children.  He is the sole provider for the family, and his income from animal husbandry is the sole source of income for the family.  Now Elmurod needs to increase livestock headcount.  With this goal in mind, he requested a loan to buy several heads of young bulls.

loans.use: to buy several young bulls in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two desktop computers.

loans.name: Nanor Group

texts.fr: NANOR est un groupement composé de 10 personnes dont Khady qui est leur présidente. Elles habitent dans le même quartier. Khady est mariée et mère de famille. On la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle évolue dans le commerce des produits alimentaires comme le riz, l’huile, le sucre, le lait. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre ces produits alimentaires. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans et commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Khady aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle souhaite avoir un hôtel à l’avenir et être la gérante.
texts.en:
Nanor is a group made up of ten women, including their president, named Khady. They all live in the same neighborhood.

Khady is married and the mother of a family. She's the one raising her hand in the photograph. Her field of business is selling food products, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar and milk.

She's seeking a loan to buy and resell these products. She has more than ten years of experience, and she's open for business for 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Khady helps her husband cover the daily expenses of the family and the children's school expenses. She wishes to own and manage a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar and milk

loans.name: Roxana Abigail

texts.es: Roxana de 21 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo y su grupo familiar. Roxana se dedica a la venta de dulces de forma ambulante desde hace 6 años. Así es como va sacando adelante a su hijo y apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de mercadería por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de dulces para tener mayor inventario y poder ofrecer a más clientes.
texts.en:
21-year old Roxana is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her son and other family members. Roxana has earned her living selling candy in nearby streets for six years. This is how she provides for her son and helps her family with household expenses.

Roxana has now decided to invest money in her business by buying more merchandise. She has approached FUSAI for a loan to buy more candy so she has a wider variety of stock which will attract more customers.

loans.use: buy more candy

loans.name: Tity

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Tity from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown. She is married with three children. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2001, Tity established her cookery business. She began her business because she wants to generate income to educate her children. She works at the business seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation problems within her operation area.

Tity requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Tity plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
Азиза жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1976 году. Азиза разведенная и имеет 1 ребенка. Она живет вместе со своей мамой и своим ребенком. Азиза работает в государственной организации. Она уже давно планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Азиза не имеет достаточно денег для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Азиза запрашивает 
Займ на сумму 7500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Aziza is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1976. Aziza is divorced and has one toddler. She lives with her mother and child. Aziza works in a state organization.

For a long time, she has been planning to repair her home, since her home is in poor conditions. Aziza does not have enough money to purchase building materials like cement, wood, paint, and the like. Aziza is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Rainabi 2 Group

texts.fr: RAINABI 2 est un groupement composé de 10 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et ont une même ambition. Aminata est leur présidente, c'est elle qui est assis avec la foulard de couleur orange, elle évolue dans la commercialisation des produits alimentaires  comme le riz, l’huile, le sucre, le lait. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des produits alimentaires. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer  à 18h et aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes et  frais de scolarité. Aminata voudrait avoir un grand magasin et diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
Rainabi 2 is a group made up of 10 people who live in the same neighborhood and share the same ambition. Aminata is their president. She's the one sitting and wearing an orange scarf in the photograph.

Her field of business is selling food products, such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, and milk. She's seeking this loan to buy and resell such products. She's open for business from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Aminata helps her husband cover the daily expenses of the family, as well as the school expenses. She would like to have a larger store and diversify her product offering.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Luis Holaya

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre activo y trabajador de 30 años de edad que durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en el área de la belleza, inició tomando cursos de capacitación y luego comenzó a trabajar en diferentes salas de belleza y peluquerías; un tiempo después tomó la decisión de independizarse y montar su propio negocio con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos personales; fue así como surgió su sala de belleza, donde trabaja todos los días prestando el servicio de corte, cepillados, barbería, manicure y pedicure; gracias a su buen trabajo ya es reconocido en el sector.
Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de realizar mejoras locativas al establecimiento (pintar paredes) y pagar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente; esto le permitirá dar una mejor imagen al negocio que sea más llamativa para atraer nuevos y potenciales clientes, que le mejoren los ingresos por la prestación de sus servicios.
Luis tiene como meta a mediano plazo, acreditar y fortalecer aún más su negocio y convertirlo en un spa, donde ofrezca muchos más servicios y pueda tener mayor rentabilidad para que le permita disfrutar mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is an active and hardworking thirty-year-old man who has spent his working life involved in the beauty business. He started out by taking some training courses and then started working at different beauty salons and hairdresser's. 

Some time later he decided to become independent and start his own business, in hopes of improving his personal income. That is how his beauty salon got started. He works there every day offering his services: haircuts, hairdos, barber shop, manicure, and pedicure. He is well known in his field thanks to his good work.

He is currently requesting this loan in order to pay off the balance on a loan he has pending with another organization that has a higher interest rate and to make improvements to his business location (painting the walls. This will allow him to improve his business' image so that it is brighter and may attract new potential customers who by receiving his services will help his income improve.

Luis' medium-term goal is to further boost and strengthen his business and convert it into a spa where he can offer many more services and have more profitability in order to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to paint the walls of his beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy stock at wholesale prices (cakes, grains, sugar, chocolate, coffee etc.) and a display stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and fufu (dough made from cassava) for her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is single and has one child. She is 32 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz Tangub City.

Merlinda sells the local delicacy "puto" (steamed rice cakes) to earn a living. She has had this business for seven months. She has requested a loan to purchase goods for her snack vending business. Merlinda is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business in other places.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her snack vending business

location.town: Tangub-P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.en:
Tranquilina is 56 years old and lives in Migacanaway, Tangub City. She is married and has three children.

Tranquilina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to purchase a parcel of land for farming. She wants to cultivate land to have another source of income in addition to her sari-sari store.

Tranquilina has been a member of PMPC since 2010 and has taken previous loans which she repaid in a timely fashion. In the future, Tranquilina hopes to improve her livelihood in order to provide more services for her clients.

loans.use: To purchase a parcel of land for farming

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María de 46 años de edad es casada y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 13 años de edad. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace 8 años. Desea mejorar las condiciones del baño sanitario por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y puerta ya que actualmente no está muy seguro y desea dar mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en: María is 46, married and lives in her own home together with her husband and their son, aged 13. She has worked for 8 years as a domestic worker. She wants to improve the condition of their bathroom. She is asking for this loan through FUSAI to invest it in buying cement, sand, bricks, iron and a door because currently the bathroom is not very secure and she wants to provide better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and a door to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Lorena Guadalupe

texts.es: Lorena de 28 años edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad y su madre. Lorena es muy trabajadora desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida mediante la elaboración y venta de deliciosos duces de feria los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de dulces como: azucar, coco, tamarindo, naranja, etc. y así poder cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Lorena is 28 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own house with her 12-year-old son and her mother. Lorena is very hard-working, and for a long time now she has earned a living by preparing and selling delicious traditional sweets, which she sells as a mobile vendor and from the house where she lives. With the aim of improving her income, she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying supplies to prepare her sweets, such as sugar, coconut, tamarind, oranges, etc. In this way she will be able to fulfill greater demand which will allow her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut, tamarind, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more merchandise for her direct selling business. Her loan helped not just in the business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. As a widow, she works hard to provide for her everyday needs. She also has a reloading station for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maricel dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. Each week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Camino Al Progreso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Camino al Progreso está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una exuberante vegetación, es muy visitado por propios y extraños por ser el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura. Las socias siempre se encuentran en la búsqueda de mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares,  hacen lo posible para que sus familias especialmente sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es  la Señora. Gladys, es socia del grupo desde hace un año tiempo en el que ha pasado gratos momentos a lado de sus amigas ya que en las reuniones pueden platicar de varios temas y aprenden con las charlas de educación.
Doña Gladys tiene 24 años de edad, está divorciada y ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo está en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de un familia. 
La Señora. Gladys es una socia que lucha a diario para entregarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, por el momento se encuentra trabajando en una fábrica de jeans las ocho horas del día. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la entrada para la compra de una máquina de coser para dedicarse a la confección de ropa. Su sueño es  tener su propio taller.
texts.en:
The communal bank Camino al Progreso comprises seven women who live in the surrounding areas of the parish of Turi in Cuenca, a place full of exhuberant vegetation which locals and outsiders alike often visit because it is a vantage point from where you can see the city. Its people work raising animals and farming. The members of this group are always looking to improve the financial stability of their households and do everything they can for their families, specially their children, to have more opportunities.

Gladys is one of the members of this group. She has been a member for one year and during this time she has spent wonderful moments alongside her friends, because during meetings they are able to talk about several topics and they learn from the educational talks.

Gladys is 24 years old. She is divorced and has two children, ages five and three. Her oldest is in school. She doesn't have her own house, so she lives with a relative. She fights every day for her children to have a better future. She currently works at a jeans factory eight hours a day.

She will invest her loan in a down payment on a sewing machine she wants to purchase in order to start making clothing. Her dream is to open her own shop.

loans.use: to make a down payment on a sewing machine.

loans.name: Cashaloma  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Cashaloma está formado por 5 socias y 2 socios quienes laboran en diferentes actividades, las mismas que les ayudan a mejorar la economía de sus hogares, en especial se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas. Viven por el cantón de Nabón lugar que goza de mucha vegetación y de verdes prados,  su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo colonial.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, este es su primer crédito y quiere apoyar para que el grupo crezca y cada vez se mas unido.
La Señora Rosa tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 9 años de edad, dos de sus hijos están en el colegio y dos en la escuela, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos, a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y para la venta, también  se dedica a la costura fabricando polleras (vestimenta típica). 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y telas. Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Cashaloma comprises five female members and two male members who all work in different businesses that help them improve their household economy. Particularly they work raising animals and farming, while many of them work in the city carrying out other types of business. They live in the canton of Nabón, a place with lots of vegetation and green meadows. Its architecture is a mix of modern and colonial.

Rosa is one of its members. This is her first loan and she wants to do her part for the group to grow and become more and more united. Rosa is 34 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage. Their ages are sixteen, fourteen, twelve, and nine. All four of them are in school. Her husband works in construction and they own the house where they live.

Rosa works raising chickens and pigs, and farming produce for home consumption as well as to sell. She also works sewing, making traditional skirts. She will invest the money from her loan in buying fertilizer, seeds, and fabric. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en: Byambadorj, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2007. His wife has a position as a train attendant and has worked for almost one year. Their two children go to school and kindergarten. He is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to buy automobile spare parts. By using those spare parts he can replace the damaged and outdated parts of his car, which is his main asset in generating income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Bat-Erdene, 25 years old, lives in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as manager at a restaurant since 2008. He is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as shingles, bricks, and planks for house renovation. During this period of time, prices of building materials have reached the bottom level so buying now will benefit him greatly. After renovation, he will also reduce coal consumption, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 56 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 
Lourdes has been working in hog raising for 15 years and earns approximately PHP 8,000.00 each month doing this type of work. Now she has 8 piglets from her sow and 1 boar. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase 2 sacks of starter feed and 3 sacks of booster feed for her hog raising activity. Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for 7 years already. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of starter feed and 3 sacks of booster feed

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Buen Samaritano” conformado por 08 socias responsables y trabajadores. Reyna de 34 años casada con 01 hijo. Hace más de 01 año que se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos como chompas, chalinas, guantes, frazadas entre otros accesorios. Con el crédito  anterior pudo  comprar  su cuarta máquina de coser. Se siente feliz pues cada vez mejora su negocio. Su último crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de su quinta máquina de coser.   El deseo de Reyna es de independizarse ya que por el momento trabaja con su hermana. El grupo “El Buen Samaritano” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Reyna se encuentra de pie, es la primera del lado derecho,  viste polo color lila y chompa turquesa. En la parte superior a lado izquierdo está Irma la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The group "El Buen Samaritano" (The Good Samaritan) consists of eight responsible and hardworking members.

Reyna is 34 years old, married, and has one child. She has been making knitted items such as sweaters, scarves, mittens, blankets, and other accessories for more than a year. With her previous loan, Reyna was able to buy her fourth sewing machine. She is very happy each time her business improves.

Her latest loan request will be used to buy her fifth sewing machine. Reyna's wish is to become independent, but at the moment she is working with her sister.

The group "El Buen Samaritano" would like to thank those who made this loan possible. Reyna is standing on the right side, wearing a lilac-colored shirt and a turquoise sweater. The smaller photo in the left-hand corner is that of Irma, who was not able to arrive on time because of her work.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
Florife previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. She also sells fruits, vegetables, and frozen foods for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florife dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to be successful in life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, allowing her to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Reseau Group

texts.fr: RESEAU est un groupement de 13 personnes. Elles vivent dans le même quartier et se réunissent chaque fois de besoin. Leur président s’appelle Ndèye Coumba, on la reconnait sur la photo par la main sur la poitrine. Elle évolue dans  l’achat et la vente de riz dans la commune. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de 4ans dans cette activité. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre du riz. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 13. Ndèye Coumba veut renforcer son fond de roulement et ouvrir une boutique de vente de riz et avoir le monopole dans la commune.
texts.en:
"Reseau" is a group of 13 people. They all live in the same area and get together when they need to. Their president is named Ndèye Coumba; she has her hand on her chest in the photo. She is married and a mother of a family. She helps her husband to take care of the everyday expenses and her children's school fees.

Ndèye Coumba works buying and selling rice in the area. She has done this for four years. She starts her day at 9 a.m. and finishes at 1 p.m.

She is seeking a loan to buy and sell rice. 

Ndèye Coumba wants to increase her cash flow, open a shop and have a monopoly selling rice in her area.

loans.use: to buy rice to resell

loans.name: Flora Aydes

texts.es:
Flora es una madre soltera de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo; pues nunca ha recibido el apoyo del padre de sus hijos.
Se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer activa y guerrera, durante muchos años trabajó como auxiliar de cocina en un restaurante, luego pasó a trabajar como empleada doméstica interna en una casa de familia; pero con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con sus hijos desea independizarse y montar su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas; la idea surge por la necesidad y para aprovechar que posee amplia experiencia en el manejo de alimentos.
Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará el carrito de perros, pipeta a gas propano, utensilios de cocina, surtido al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas) y una vitrina calentadora; así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar muy buenos resultados para seguir apoyando económicamente a sus hijos.
Flora manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ver su negocio en funcionamiento, pues sabe que con mucho trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación podrá sacarlo adelante y lograr que sea reconocido en el sector; así estará en la capacidad de dar mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar a los que ama.
texts.en:
Flora is a single mother of three children. She has never received any support from their father, so she has put a lot of effort into providing for them. She has always been an active woman and a fighter. For many years she worked as a kitchen assistant in a restaurant. Then she worked for a family as a domestic. But in order to spend more time with her children, she wants to become independent and start her own business selling fast food. Her idea stems from her need and because she will be able to make the most of her extensive food-handling experience.

This has motivated her to request the support of a loan, which she will use to purchase a hot-dog cart, a propane burner, kitchen utensils, wholesale ingredients (buns, meats, sauces, sodas), and a heating case. This will allow her to start her business venture, which she expects will give very good results in order for her to continue financially supporting her children.

Flora says her greatest desire is to see her business running because she knows that with a lot of hard work, effort, and dedication, she will be able to keep it going and make it well-known in the neighborhood. And she will be in a position to give her loved ones better living standards and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a hot-dog cart, a propane burner, kitchen utensils, wholesale ingredients (buns, meats, sauces, sodas), and a heating case.

loans.name: Alba Ruth

texts.es:
Alba es una madre soltera de 45 años de edad, que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos.
Es reconocida en el sector por su amabilidad y por la tenacidad con la que trabaja día a día para salir adelante, sobrepasando los obstáculos que se le presentan. 
Durante su vida productiva trabajó como empleada en diferentes almacenes del municipio donde reside, allí obtuvo la experiencia y el conocimiento necesario en el manejo de negocios comerciales; esto la motivó a independizarse e iniciar su propio almacén de variedades, en el que ofrece artículos decorativos para el hogar, accesorios de bisutería, dulces, artículos e insumos para confecciones y para elaborar accesorios, imágenes religiosas y todo tipo de detalles para toda ocasión; además presta servicios adicionales de arreglo de prendas de vestir como poner cierres, marquillas y coger el ruedo de los pantalones y jeans; esto le genera ingresos adicionales con los que solventa las necesidades básicas en el hogar.
Alba manifiesta que su principal sueño es fortalecer y ampliar su negocio, por ello lucha incansablemente para lograrlo y siempre está en constante búsqueda de alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por ello encuentra en el crédito una oportunidad para hacerlo; pues con el dinero comprará surtido al por mayor (accesorios, artículos decorativos, dulces, tarjetería, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda y los gustos de su clientela, haciendo que las ventas se incrementen y por ende los ingresos que recibe; así estará en la capacidad de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Alba is a 45-year-old single mother who has been able to forge ahead with her two children with great effort and dedication. She is known in her trade for her friendliness and her perseverance in her work day after day. As a result, she has been able to move forward and overcome the obstacles that she has encountered along they way.

Throughout her productive life, Alba has worked as an employee at different stores in the town where she lives. This was how she gained the experience and knowledge that is necessary for managing retail businesses. For this reason, she became independent and started her own variety store where she offers household decorations, personal accessories, sweets, materials and supplies for making accessories, religious articles, and gifts for all occasions. In addition, Alba provides services such as clothing repair. This includes putting on zippers, attaching tags, and hemming trousers and jeans. As a result, she is able to generate extra income for meeting basic household needs.

Alba says that her main goal is to strengthen and expand her business. For this reason, she works tirelessly to accomplish her mission and is constantly looking at different alternatives that will help her continue advancing. Obtaining a loan is an opportunity to make her goal possible. The money will be used to buy inventory in bulk such as accessories, decorative items, sweets, greeting cards, and other items. Since she will be able to restock, Alba can satisfy the demands and tastes of her customers. This will lead to increased sales and eventually more income that will give Alba the ability to provide a better quality of life and improved well-being for her family.

loans.use: to buy accessories, decorative items, sweets, greeting cards, and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en: Gantuya, 39 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an attendant at a hospital since 2008. Her husband has is by profession a welder and worked for three years at a private firm. She and her husband have been growing vegetables in their greenhouse for a while. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase and install a heater into their greenhouse so that she can grow vegetables in winter time. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase and install a heater into her  greenhouse

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store, which she has had for thirteen years now. Her income from the business is assisting with her everyday household expenditures. She continues to work to provide for her family's needs. 
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result kn better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norberta hopes that her business will last long and that she will have other sources of income. Weekly, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilibeth hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed and additional hogs for her piggery

loans.name: Sixta Janeth

texts.es: Sixta de 32 años de edad, habita con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 9 años, en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Cartagena. En esta población es usual que sus mujeres, se dediquen a la elaboración de bolsos,  mochilas  y hamacas en tejido vertical. Esta tradición es transmitida de generación en generación y de esta misma manera la adquirió, hace 14 años, Sixta, generando ingresos que benefician su hogar. Los productos principales de su oferta son las mochilas, las hamacas y los bolos, que son vendidos a almacenes del municipio y otros clientes en la ciudad de Barranquilla, en el Departamento del Atlántico; sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, con una frecuencia diaria. Su meta es lograr aumento en sus ventas y para ello requiere tener materias primas e insumos en un mayor volumen,  para tejer más productos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará hilos e insumos, en mayor cantidad que lo acostumbrado. Su meta mas adelante es mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y trabajar continuamente para ahorrar y tener los recursos suficientes para ello.
texts.en:
Sixta, who is 32 years old, lives with her husband and their two children aged 5 and 9 in a town near the city of Cartagena. Among the local population it is common for the women to earn a living making bags, rucksacks and hammocks from vertical woven cloth. This tradition is handed down from generation to generation and this is also how Sixta learned the trade 14 years ago. This gives her an income which benefits her household. The main products she makes are rucksacks, hammocks and bags, which are sold to stores in the town and other customers in the city of Barranquilla, in the Atlántico department. She sells on both cash and credit terms, on a daily basis. 

Her goal is to increase her sales and to do this she needs raw materials and supplies in larger quantities, to weave more products. This is the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan. This will be her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy thread and supplies, in larger quantities than normal. Her goal for further in the future is to improve her living conditions and to work continuously so she can save up and have the money to do this.

loans.use: to buy thread and supplies in larger quantities.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida previously accessed a PHP 30,000 loan that she used to purchase stocks of balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Zenaida would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 35,000, to buy stocks of balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for stocks of balut (fertilized duck eggs) and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Laura Dayance

texts.es:
Laura es madre soltera de dos hijos de 13 y 15 años, a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes cafeterías y restaurantes por varios años, allí obtuvo la experiencia y el conocimiento necesario para el manejo de este tipo de negocios; luego de un tiempo abrió su propia cafetería que funcionó por varios meses, pero por obras de construcción en la zona tuvo que cerrarlo; porque las ventas cayeron; hoy en día, a sus 31 años de edad, desea iniciar un restaurante ubicado en el centro de desarrollo comunitario del municipio, para lo cual ya posee el local, pero requiere comprar silletería y mesas, un refrigerador, utensilios de cocina y ollas, pipeta de gas propano y surtido al por mayor (verduras, carnes, granos, gaseosas, frutas, entre otros), para lo cual está solicitando el apoyo del crédito.
Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su nuevo proyecto productivo con el que desea generar muy buenos resultados para continuar velando por el bienestar de sus hijos.
Laura tiene como propósito a mediano plazo, el montaje de un restaurante de comida internacional en un local propio; que le genere mayor rentabilidad y le permita dar a sus hijos una educación universitaria que los forme como profesionales y como hombres íntegros para que tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso y disfruten mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Laura is a single mother of two children ages 13 and 15 that she has supported with great effort. In her professional life she has worked in different cafeterias and restaurants for several years. Here she gained the knowledge and experience necessary to manage this type of business. Later she opened her own cafeteria for several months, but decreased sales due to construction work in the area forced her to close it. 

Now, at 31 years old, she would like to start a restaurant in the local community development center. She already has the property for this but needs to purchase seating, tables, a refrigerator, kitchen utensils and pans, a propane gas pipette and wholesale inventory (vegetables, meat, grains, soft drinks, fruit and other items). For this she is requesting the support of a loan. This will allow her to put her new business project into operation. She hopes it will have good results in order to continue to safeguard the well-being of her children.

Laura's medium-term goal is to establish a restaurant with international food on her own property that creates a high profitability and allows her to provide a university education for her children. She wants to see them to be professionals and upstanding men so they have a prosperous future and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seating, tables, a refrigerator, kitchen utensils, pans, a propane gas pipette, and wholesale goods (vegetables, meat, grains, soft drinks, fruit and other items).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric and a new sewing machine for her interior decor business

loans.name: Sanrda

texts.en:
Sandra is 22 years old and is a mother of two. She is an orphan who lost both her parents when she was 10. She grew up under the care of her maternal grandmother. Sandra has been operating a hardware shop since the beginning of 2012, after she was trained by PENYA in the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program. Sandra has now started running a hardware store after realizing that villagers were traveling more than 40 kilometers to the nearest town to buy their supplies. At her shop, she is able to provide supplies to people from the surrounding villages. Sandra will use the loan to purchase stock for her shop in bulk. She will purchase supplies such as farming implements, seeds, fertilizers, cement, and other general hardware goods. She also plans to expand her shopping space and build her own so she can stop renting the space she is currently using. With the proceeds from the shop she is able to provide for her family and send her children to school. 

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program. PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources for additional loans and business investments. Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably. Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their goods.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizers, cement and stock for resale in her hardware store

loans.name: Anyi Milena

texts.es:
Anyi es una mujer activa y emprendedora de 27 años de edad; durante su vida productiva siempre ha buscado la manera de generar ingresos por cuenta propia, inició vendiendo productos y mercancía por catálogo y, con unos ahorros que tenía inició la salsamentaría que posee actualmente; allí ofrece todo tipo de productos como mecato, gaseosas, cervezas, licor, entre otros, además tiene juegos de billar y máquinas tragamonedas para diversión de sus clientes; el negocio lleva 6 meses en funcionamiento y hasta el momento ha tenido muy buena acogida por parte de los habitantes del barrio.
Solicita el crédito con el ánimo de comprar más variedad de surtido (galletería, dulces, cervezas, gaseosas, mecato, café, entre otros), así podrá satisfacer los gustos de su clientela y mejorará las ventas e ingresos personales.
Anyi manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es posicionar bien su negocio, fortalecerlo  y acreditarlo cada vez más para que tenga permanencia en el tiempo y siga siendo su principal fuente de ingresos que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Anyi is an active and enterprising 27-year-old woman. In her working life she has always found a way to generate income on her own. She started out selling products and merchandise by catalog and, with some savings she had, she opened the store she now runs, where she sells all kinds of products, like snacks, sodas, beer, liquor, and other items. She also has pool tables and slot machines to entertain her customers. Her business has been running for six months and so far it has been very well received by the neighborhood residents.

She is requesting this loan in hopes of stocking up on a wider variety of products (cookies, sweets, beer, sodas, snacks, coffee, and other items). This will allow her to meet her customers' needs and to improve sales and personal income.

Anyi says her greatest desire is to position her business well and strengthen and boost it more and more so that it lasts a long time and can continue to be her main source of income and guarantee her financial stability so that she can improve her family unit's living standards.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sweets, beer, sodas, snacks, coffee, and other products.

loans.name: Eliana Lizbeth

texts.es:
Eliana es una mujer trabajadora de 30 años de edad, casada  madre de un hijo de 3 años.
Actualmente trabaja como vendedora en una empresa de licores, pero, con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos familiares, decidió montar su propio negocio, una papelería en la que trabaja durante sus tiempos libres, después de cumplir con su horario de trabajo en la empresa. 
Su empuje, perseverancia y las ganas de salir adelante, la motivan para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará una impresora multifuncional y una vitrina para exhibición, esto le permitirá ampliar su portafolio de servicios y además podrá almacenar mejor sus productos, logrando un aumento en las ventas.
Eliana manifiesta que su principal sueño a corto plazo, es poder independizarse totalmente para estar más tiempo con su familia y dedicarse de lleno a su negocio, por eso lucha constantemente para acreditarlo y fortalecerlo y así lograr que se convierta en su principal fuente de ingresos, que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para dar mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y disfrutar más momentos con su esposo.
texts.en:
Eliana is a hard working 30 year-old married woman with a three year-old son.

She currently works as a saleswoman for a liquor company. However, wishing to supplement the family's income, she decided to set up her own business, a stationery store where she works in her free time, after finishing her work.

Her drive, perseverance and desire to succeed motivate her to request a loan, which she will use to buy a multifunction printer and a display case. This will help her expand her portfolio of services and will allow her to better store her products, achieving an increase in sales.


Eliana says that, in the short term, her main dream is to be completely independent, in order to spend more time with her family and to dedicate herself full-time to her business. She is constantly working to strengthen the business and make it her primary source of income, one that would guarantee financial stability so that she can give her son a better quality of life and spend more time with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a multifunction printer and a display case

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mabinty from Tombo, in the western rural in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 5 and 10 years. One of her children is currently going to school. 

In 2010, Mabinty established her food stand business. She began her business because she wants to contribute in taking care of the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a transportation problem within her operation area.

Mabinty requires a loan to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to sell. 

She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to sell.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun is originally from Preah Sdach district, Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is 53 years old and is married with one child who is attending school. She has devoted her effort and time to the farming business for over 30 years as it is the major source of income. Her husband always gives her a lot of support by tilling their farm, and he is also working in the hog raising business to augment the family's income.

Recently Hun has applied for financial assistance of USD 500 to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and bricks to build a proper latrine for her family. She will also use the remaining balance to pay for labor costs. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Hun is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and bricks to build a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Ovaltine, pop drinks, milk, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 51-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has 4 children aged 32, 30, 28 and 22. In 2006, Fatmata established her baby clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to help support her family. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are visitors to the market. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy diapers, baby oil, etc. for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to attract more customers by offering more diverse merchandise. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business. She also hopes to see her daughter educated to the university level. She is excited for the loan and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: requires a loan in order to buy diapers, baby oil, etc. for resale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 46-year-old woman from the town of Cortes in Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has three children. Two are adults while the youngest, Mary Angelou, is still studying in college. Veronica's husband is a carpenter, but the demand for him to work is not always consistent. So Veronica has been in the business of producing and selling nipa (palm leaf) roofing shingles as well as firewood. She started the business four years ago and earns 5000 PHP. She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy bamboo sticks and sagisi (a type of rope) to produce more nipa shingles.

The profit that she will get from this increase in supply allows her to buy nutritious meals for her family and pay for school fees.

In the future, Veronica hopes to have a bigger and successful business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo sticks and sagisi (rope for making shingles)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, butter, cola, spray, and other items for business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, onion, salt, pepper, etc. to increase her business volume.

loans.name: Seh D.

texts.en:
Seh D. has been running a bakery in Buchanan where he bakes and sells many types of bread. He started this business with help from his friend and learned this way of selling from a baking school. Presently, the problem he faces is that the size of sales is very small since he has more customers. He is requesting a loan to increase his customer traffic by buying more flour, butter, oil, charcoal, etc. for his business. He enjoys his business because it is the only source of generating some income.

Seh D. is a 12th-grade graduate, 55 years of age, married to a business woman, and has six children aged between 7 and 30; among his six children some are attending collage while others are attending high school. Only five of them live at home in Buchanan city. His dream is to expand his business even more and build a house for his children.

loans.use: to increase his customer traffic by buying more flour, butter, oil, charcoal, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Doris Elena

texts.es:
Doris es reconocida por su carisma y dedicación a la familia, una mujer activa de 52 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucha paciencia y esfuerzo. Se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, pues el amor por esta actividad la heredó de su madre y su abuela; inició trabajando como operaria en diferentes empresas y luego de 15 años de labores y de adquirir la experiencia y el conocimiento necesarios, llegó el matrimonio y los hijos, razón que la motivó a independizarse y montar su propio taller en un espacio de su casa; con el fin de generar ingresos y al mismo tiempo cuidar de su familia; así lleva 19 años, luchando incansablemente para mejorar cada día y seguir adelante.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de unas guías para la máquina recurbridora, que son indispensables para realizar su trabajo con un acabado perfecto y así cumplir a sus clientes con la entrega de los pedidos a tiempo; pues estará en la capacidad de agilizar y optimizar los tiempos de producción, mejorando las ventas y abriendo paso para adquirir nuevos contratos.
Doris manifiesta que su único interés es darle continuidad a su negocio tal y como está, pues así ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y le ha permitido disfrutar una buena calidad de vida en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Doris is known to be a charismatic woman, devoted to her family. She is 52 years old, married and has three children. She has raised her children with patience and hard work. Doris works in the textile industry. She inherited the love for this activity from her mother and from her grandmother. She started working as a machine operator for different companies. Fifteen years later, when she had acquired the necessary experience and knowledge, she got married and had children, so she decided to become independent and opened her own workshop at home. She wanted to generate her own income and at the same take care of her family. She has been doing this for nineteen years, working tirelessly to improve and get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy guideways for her overlock machine, which are essential to do a perfect job and fulfill her customers’ orders on time. She will now be able to improve her production and optimize her processes, which will result in increased sales and more orders.

Doris says that her only interest is to continue working as she has been doing it so far, since she has managed to improve her family’s living conditions and has lived a good life together with her beloved ones.

loans.use: to buy guideways for her overlock machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stationery items (pens, copy books, reading books, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, palm oil, cassava, palm-nut, soft drinks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock in bulk (chips, sweets, coffee, sodas, beers, pastries, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel and his family own a chain of grocery stores in Elizabeth. His father owned grocery stores after emigrating from Cuba in the ‘60s, and the business remains in the family to this day.

Without formal education, Angel and his family were able to grow the grocery chain. The deli portion of the grocery store offers hot sandwiches, salads, and soups—making availability and variety of products something that sets the grocery chain apart from their competition.

The funds from this loan will go toward new equipment and merchandise, such as coolers and an ice machine for the deli. Eventually, the family would like to purchase the commercial property that the grocery stores are located on.

loans.use: To purchase coolers and an ice machine for family-run grocery chain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, palm oil and cooking season to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a 49-year-old hardworking woman who lives with her husband, Badal, age 52 years. They have two children, studying in class VIII and class IX (grade 8 and grade 9). Malati is illiterate, but knows how to sign her name. Badal has read up to class VI (grade 6). They live in a semi-pakka house at Dhupguri.

Malati, being a housewife, looks after her family throughout the day, and her husband is a businessman. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to rear their children and to lead a proper lifestyle for them in this era of expense. 

Malati decided to give support to her husband financially. She has taken the decision to purchase a dairy cow and sell the milk and dairy products in the market to start her earning for her family. Cow milk is in great demand in her local area, and she knows well that she will be able to earn profit by selling cow milk as well as dairy products in her area. She needs capital to solve this purpose, and so she is taking the loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to buy a cow. 

In the future, she wants to build a cattle farm with the profit from this business, and also hopes for a pakka (concrete) house to stay with her family comfortably. 

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her money to start the business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling dairy products and milk in the village market.

loans.name: Mirembe School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Francis. He is the head teacher of Mirembe Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namuwongo in Kampala with 450 students. Mirembe Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultrafiltration water treatment system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an ultrafiltration water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mirembe Junior will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Francis ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry-bush-meat for her business.

loans.name: Latonia

texts.en:
Latonia owns a home-based childcare business in East Orange. As a foster parent of five children, Latonia has always had a passion for raising children. She has been in business for one year, and currently employs three people.

The funds from this loan will go towards toys and equipment (such as cribs, play mats, and decorations) for Latonia’s modest business. Eventually, she would like to own her own official daycare and serve more families in the area.

loans.use: To purchase toys and equipment for childcare business

loans.name: Waterford School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Edison. He is the head teacher of Waterford Nursery & Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Najjanankumbi in Wakiso with 650 students. Waterford Nursery & Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with two 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Waterford Nursery & Primary will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Edison ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, 46, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Federico and a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Amelita operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal orders for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.
 
Amelita dreams of having more customers and hopes to become successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, es madre de tres hijos de 15, 18 y 22 años, es soltera, como toda una jefa de hogar responsable se dedica a vender pupusas para tener ingresos con los que cubre las necesidades de su familia, a la facha no ha tenido dificultad en realizar esta actividad.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar chicharrón, quesillo, harina, aceite, aderezos, repollo, etc., con lo que se mantendrá trabajando y mejorara el servicio hacia sus clientes, espera tener nuevos clientes, aumentar las ventas y tener la liquidez necesaria para cancelar la deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable, mejorar su vivienda y continuar dándole lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is single and has three children aged 15, 18 and 22. As a responsible head of the household, she works selling pupusas (a sort of filled corn tortilla) to make enough money to cover the family's needs. Up until now, she has had no difficulty in carrying out this work.

Ana will use this loan to buy ingredients such as ground pork meat, soft cheese, flour, oil, seasoning and cabbage. With this she will be able to continue working and improving her services for her customers. She hopes to make new customers, increase her sales, and to have sufficient cash-flow to make her loan repayments. Her dream is to have a more profitable business, improve her house and continue to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as ground pork meat, soft cheese, flour, oil, seasoning and cabbage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugarcane for her business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José de 27 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su madre y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. José es el que sostiene la economía del hogar dado que su madre no trabaja y su hijo está muy pequeño. José trabaja como auxiliar de albañil de esta forma se gana la vida y va ganando experiencia para que en el futuro pueda ser un buen albañil y trabajar de forma independiente. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio de bahareque, por lo que necesita comprar lámina, madera y vara de castilla. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento y así comenzar la construcción del cuarto lo antes posible.
texts.en: Jose is 27 years old and lives under humble conditions with his mother and young 4 years old son.  Jose supports the household since his mother doesn’t work and his son is very small.  Jose works as a mason’s helper, earns a living this way, and has gained experience so that he work independently.  He wants to improve his living conditions so he is asking for a loan through FUSAI so he can build a bedroom.  He hopes to get this loan so he can start as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a big freezer and local cattle for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale prices, such as bedroom sets, living room furniture, dining room furniture and night tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a restaurant/pub and buy a cooler, shelves, a sound system, wholesale stock, and other items.

loans.name: Eider

texts.es:
Eider es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque es padre de familia, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, es por ello que se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente ha sembrado en su parcela yuca y con mucho esmero y dedicación cuida de ese cultivo.

Eider está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, y solventar los gastos de regadío de su cultivo, de esta manera podrá tener una mejor cosecha y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en:
Eider is a hardworking man and above all father, so he strives every day to get ahead.  He is a farmer and has planted a parcel of yucca and cares for it with lots of effort and enthusiasm.

Eider is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy fertilizer, compost and pay for irrigation.  In this way he will be able to have a better harvest and continue working toward making his dream a reality, “Having a home built of solid materials.”

loans.use: to buy supplies and irrigation.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer activa y carismática de 48 años de edad, madre de un hijo al que ha sacado adelante con mucha paciencia y esfuerzo, y convive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Se gana la vida atendiendo su propia tienda de abarrotes que lleva un año de funcionamiento, allí ofrece gaseosas, café, mecato, lácteos, galletería y otros productos de la canasta familiar. La idea surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Como todo ser humano, Luz también tiene aspiraciones y sueños, el principal es poder acreditar y posicionar su negocio en el sector, para que éste sea rentable y tenga permanencia en el tiempo, garantizándole una estabilidad económica favorable que le permita brindar mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar, pero para lograrlo, solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comenzará a fortalecer el inventario con pastas, granos, galletería, mecatos, carnes frías, gaseosas, entre otros; así estará en la capacidad de satisfacer la demanda actual y los gustos de sus clientes; logrando un aumento notable en las ventas y en los ingresos que percibe por el desarrollo de su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Luz, 48, is an energetic and charismatic woman. She has raised a son with patience and hard work and lives in a common-law marriage. She earns a living with her grocery store, which she has had for a year now. She sells beverages, coffee, snacks, dairy products, bakery products and other staple products. She started this business when she realized the need to generate an income to help her husband with the home expenses.

As any other human being, Luz also has aspirations and dreams.
