Her biggest dream is to be able to become well-known locally and have a profitable and sustainable business which can guarantee her financial stability. This way, she will be able to improve her family’s quality of life. She needs however help for this, so she is requesting a loan to stock her store with pasta, grains, bakery products, snacks, cold cuts, beverages, etc. This will help her to fulfill her customers’ demands and increase her sales.

loans.use: to stock her store with pasta, grains, bakery products, snacks, cold cuts and beverages, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee, beer, sodas, snacks, sweets, cookies, and other items.

loans.name: Coster

texts.en:
Coster, 43, is an experienced maize (corn) and vegetable farmer, with a family of ten from Chibombo District, Zambia. He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a maize milling machine so that he can provide a milling service to over 600 families in his community. 

The maize milling machine takes raw maize (corn) and creates a maize flour which is the staple food in Zambia. Most rural families in Chibombo District grow maize on their small farms and store it and use it as their primary supply of food for the year. After the kernels are removed from the cob, they then have to be milled to create flour, which can then be boiled to make what is locally called Nshima. Coster is already a well-respected member in his community and wants to expand his business to offer the maize milling service. 

Rent-to-Own has done market research in Coster’s community and has determined that the location for this equipment is ideal. The closest maize mill is over 6 km away, but is often broken down. This means most potential customers have to travel more than 13 km to a roadside market, and since most will walk or use their bicycles to travel to the maize mill, it is certain they will prefer to use this maize mill rather than traveling a longer distance. 

Equipment such as a maize mill can be a major boost for many enterprising farmers such as Coster, as it allows for him to diversify his business. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a maize mill are very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Coster will be able to get a maize mill from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it. 

This loan will help Coster on the path to building up a viable business that can provide for his family and community throughout the year. It is for this reason Coster is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a maize mill as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a maize milling machine

loans.name: Tuvshinbayar

texts.en: Tuvshinbayar, 25 years old, lives with his mother and two siblings in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He and his mother have been running a grocery store since 2009. His brothers are both studying at university. He also has talent for drawing and painting. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy food items in large quantity, so that he can continue to run his grocery store without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is one of our reliable clients and paid his previous loan without a single delay.

loans.use: to buy food items in large amounts

loans.name: Action Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Action” group. They are small scale businessmen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 2,500,000 SLL for the entire group from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.
 
The featured leader of this group is Abdul. Abdul is age 35. He was born in Tonkolili district, northern Sierra Leone. Abdul is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools. For a number of years now, Abdul has been selling used clothes. He has requested this loan in order to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Enila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 54-year-old Esther from Mutare. She is married with three children. She also cares for one other dependent. Esther runs a retail business selling ladies' suits, kids' wear and footwear. The business has been in operation for five years. She says one of the main challenges faced is that some clients fail to pay her on time. 

Esther has requested a loan of $400 to purchase ladies' suits, kids' wear and footwear for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future Esther plans to have ownership of a boutique shop. Esther is a member of Enila group.

loans.use: to buy ladies suits, kidswear and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Maseray from Waterloo2 Western rural in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 6 years.  

In 2010, Maseray established her food stand business. She began her business because she wants to get daily survival. She works at the business from 7:30 am to 6:00pm , 7 days per week. She says that her major problem to her business is sometime purchasing power is very slow.

Maseray requires a loan to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning for resale.  

She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Maseray plans to build a permanent business location. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to sell.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Saren, aged 23, is a farmer from a rural village of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and has one daughter who is photographed with her in the photo. Her husband also works as a farmer, so they work together on their own farm growing rice to sell. Like other farmers, Saren is using traditional farming methods in tilling their farm and earns a decent income to provide for her family.

As of now, she is asking for a loan to build a safe latrine for her family, as she doesn't have a latrine and she realizes that this will not help her family's health. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Saren is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a safe latrine for her family

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is a 38-year-old women living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has 4 children. Her husband has manufactured artificial jewelry for 20 years. This is the only source of income for his family. 

Rizwana requests a loan to buy polish, stones, and a soldering rod for her husband’s jewelry business, because they do not have sufficient funds to buy these items. She hopes that the loan will help her husband's business to be productive. 

Rizwana is very thankful to KIVA and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy polish, stones, and a soldering rod to manufacture artificial jewelry.

loans.name: Sukhbaatar

texts.en: Sukhbaatar, 61 years old, lives with his wife in a rental Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2008. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. He is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to buy a Mongolian traditional five wall ger, so he and his wife can live in a comfortable and warm place as a new ger is invulnerable against snow and storm. Also they will burn less coal for heating thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy a Mongolian traditional ger

loans.name: Edgar De Jesús

texts.es:
Edgar, con 51 años de edad, luego de quedarse sin empleo por la terminación del contrato en la empresa donde trabajaba y, viéndose con necesidades económicas, decidió montar su propio negocio, una pequeña chaza ambulante donde vende mecato, minutos a celular, dulces, alimentos fritos, cigarrillos y otros productos, esta idea surgió con el ánimo de generar ingresos por cuenta propia, ya que se le dificultaba conseguir oportunidades de empleo por su edad, trabaja solo todos los días de 7 am a 7 pm, así logra generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar económicamente a su hijo y sustentar sus gastos personales.
El crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de mercancía (mecato, galletería, dulces, cigarrillos, chicles, entre otros), esto le permitirá aumentar la variedad de productos para satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus compradores y mejorar las ventas; así podrá seguir luchando para llegar a cumplir su mayor anhelo que es montar su negocio en un local comercial, para evitar los riesgos a los que se ve expuesto como trabajador de la calle; esto le daría la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y dar a su hijo un mejor bienestar, para que goce de buena salud y prosperidad.
texts.en:
Edgar, who is 51 years old, decided to start his own business when he became unemployed after his contract with the company he used to work for ran out. Finding himself in financial need, he set up a small street stand where he sells snacks, cell phone cards, sweets, fried foods, cigarettes, and other products. His idea stemmed from his hopes of generating income on his own, because it was hard for him to find a job at his age. He works by himself every day from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm, and this allows him to generate enough resources to financially support his son and cover his personal expenses.

He wants to invest this loan in purchasing merchandise (snacks, cookies, sweets, cigarettes, chewing gum, and other items). This will allow him to increase the variety of products he has to meet his customers' different preferences and improve sales. This way he will be able to keep fighting for his greatest dream, which is to set up his business in a proper commercial space in order to avoid the risks he is exposed to by working on the street. This would give him a chance to improve his income and give his son more wellbeing, so that he can have good health and prosperity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (snacks, cookies, sweets, cigarettes, chewing gum, and other items).

loans.name: Josman Wesner

texts.es:
Josman es un hombre activo y emprendedor que descubrió su talento en el campo de la barbería, por lo cual decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la ayuda económica de algunos familiares; trabaja solo todos los días con el apoyo de un empleado directo, su barbería es reconocida en el sector por el buen servicio y la agilidad con la que atienden su clientela, poco a poco ha logrado mejorar su establecimiento y además ha perfeccionado su técnica; así es como se gana la vida día tras día.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para que pueda realizar mejoras locativas (pintar el local) y restaurar las sillas de barbería y los muebles de la sala de espera que ya muestran señales de deterioro; esto le permitirá dar una mejor imagen a su negocio y atraerá nuevos clientes, además estará en la capacidad de fidelizar a los que ya posee; mejorando así los ingresos que su actividad le genera.
Josman tiene como propósito, fortalecer su negocio para mantenerse en el mercado y lograr una estabilidad económica que le permita solventar sus gastos personales y familiares y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josman is an active and enterprising man who discovered his talent as a barber and decided to start a business with financial help from some relatives. He works every day with the help of one direct employee. His barber shop is well known in the area for the good services he provides and for how quickly they serve their customers. Little by little he has managed to improve his establishment and also perfected his technique, and that is how he makes his daily living.

The loan he is requesting is to help him improve his business space. He will paint the walls and repair the barber chairs and the furniture in the waiting room, which is starting to show wear. This will allow him to give his business a better image and attract new customers. He will also be in a position to ensure the loyalty of his current customers, and improve the income his business generates for him.

Josman's goals are to strengthen his business so that it can stay in the market, and to achieve the financial stability that will allow him to cover his personal expenses as well as his family's, and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to repaint the walls of his shop and repair the chairs and furniture.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is married and has three children who are still young and completely depend on her care. Pha is 38 years old and lives in a peaceful village of the Bakan district, Pursat province. She earns a living by growing and selling rice. Her business is in a good location, where there is water irrigation, so she is able to do farming twice a year. Having a farming business for more than 10 years, she can earn  up to 30,000 KHR per day. 

As this will be her first loan with HKL, she aims to build a proper latrine for her family as her old one is not comfortable and hygienic to use any more. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Pha is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy material to build a proper latrine for her family

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
This is Rizalina, 45, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolando and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rizalina operates a buy and sell business. She buys and sells jewelry. She also repairs broken watches and jewelry.  She earns a minimum of 3,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more jewelry.
 
Rizalina hopes to have another branch of her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy different types of jewelry needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a gallon of palm wine for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 30-year-old woman residing in Punjab, Pakistan. She is a simple housewife with three sons and a daughter. Her husband is engaged in a small manufacturing concern. He operates a lathe machine and provides the services of tuning, manufacturing tools, and renewal of spare parts.

Her husband want to purchase some tools and accessories for the lathe machine, such as dies, cutters, etc., so that he will be able to provide better output. For this purpose, Zahida has requested a loan to help her husband.

She is very thankful to Kiva and it’s Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan, for providing her the loan facility for her husband’s business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and accessories, such as dies, cutters, etc., for the lathe machine.

loans.name: Cañaveral Group

texts.en:
The eleven hard-working women of this group live in San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  They named their group Cañaveral because sugar cane thrives in their area and they want their businesses to thrive as well.  The businesses they have include selling fish, corn, cookware, household goods, clothing, ice cones and one woman has a small store.  The group was acquainted with some women who had worked with Namaste and whose businesses had prospered.  They formed their group and asked to be accepted into the program.  They are eager to get the financial classes and business advice that Namaste will provide along with their loan. They look forward to the increased sales and profits that will improve life for their families.  

Cristina (first from right) is 46, and the mother of four children, two of which are still in school.  Ten years ago, she became a widow when her husband was killed in an automobile accident.  She was left, far from her family, with no way to support her children.  She moved back to live near her family and started a business making tamales and enchiladas.  From that business, she was able to save enough money to start her current business selling sheets and towels door-to-door.  One of her older children helps her out a little financially, and the two school age children sell door-to-door when they are not in school.  With her loan she is going to increase her stock and also buy children’s clothing to sell along with the sheets and towels.  Her dream is to have all her children finish their schooling, since she did not have the opportunity do so.  Her current monthly sales are approximately 4,200 Guatemalan Quetzales (US $550) with a profit of approximately 1,170 Guatemalan Quetzales (US $155).  During the next nine months she hopes to increase her sales by 25% and her profits by 36%.

loans.use: to buy more sheets, towels, and children’s clothing to sell door to door

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 47-year-old woman, residing in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family which consists of 4 daughters, 2 sons, and her husband.  Her husband provides transportation services by driving an auto rickshaw. 

Nasreen’s husband wants to purchase a new auto rickshaw because the previous rickshaw is not working properly and it requires maintenance on a daily basis. Because of this he is unable to generate the income needed to meet the family's needs. Therefore, Nasreen has applied for the loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of the profits, Nasreen and her husband want to provide a quality education to their children. Nasreen dreams of providing a bright future for her entire family. Nasreen says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new auto rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sewing machines and accessories for outdoor decor.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la provincia Carrasco, tiene 3 hijos y hasta ahora no sabe el paradero de su esposo desde que la abandono. Vivía en el departamento de Potosí pero tuvo que cambiar de residencia porque allá no tuvo ingresos suficientes  para mantener a sus hijos, después de mucho tiempo logro progresar junto a ellos, ahora tiene dos lotes agrícola y un lote urbano en Chimore donde trabaja como agricultora  y además tiene una tienda de barrio, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de productos e insumos para su tienda de abarrotes, de esa manera podrá tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Victoria is 55 years old and lives in Carrasco.  She has three children and lives in the Carrasco province.  She has three children and doesn’t know about her husband since he left her.  She lived in the Potosi department, but she had to move because she didn’t have enough money to support her children.  After some time she was able to make progress with them.  Now she has a two plots of land and an urban plot in Chimore where she works as a farmer.  She also has a neighborhood store.  She is asking for this loan to buy products and supplies for her store.  In this way she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and stock her store.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José es un hombre carismático y amable de 55 años de edad, casado y padre ejemplar de dos hijos, a los que ha sacado adelante con gran sacrificio y paciencia.
Anteriormente tenía una legumbrería ubicada en un local arrendado, pero por cuestiones externas, le solicitaron entregar el local y tuvo que dejar por poco tiempo su labor; luego decidió continuar su actividad de comerciante independiente, vendiendo frutas de manera ambulante; trabaja solo todos los días de 8 am a 6 pm y así ha logrado generar los ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando el crédito con el ánimo de comprar surtido al por mayor (frutas en cosecha), esto le permitirá darle continuidad a su actividad y mejorar la variedad de productos para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, mejorando las ventas e ingresos.
José, como todo ser humano, también tiene sueños que desea hacer realidad, uno de ellos es, montar su negocio nuevamente en un local, para que le permita generar mayor nivel de rentabilidad e ingresos y no estar expuesto a tantos peligros a los que se enfrenta trabajando de manera ambulante. Así podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
José is charismatic and kind. He is 55 years old, married, and a model father of two children, for whom he has provided with great sacrifice and patience.

Previously he had a fruit and vegetable store in a rented location, but for reasons unrelated to his business, he was asked to give up the location and he had to stop his business for a little while. He decided to continue his business by selling fruit from place to place. He works by himself every day from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., earning income to meet his family’s daily needs.

José is requesting this loan to buy stock at wholesale prices, such as fruits that are in season. This will allow him to continue his business and improve the variety of products he sells to meet his customers’ tastes. He hopes to improve his sales and income.

José, like all human beings, has dreams that he would like to make reality. One of these is to restart his business in a new location, which would allow him to achieve a higher level of profitability and income, as well as to avoid the dangers that he confronts when selling from place to place. He hopes to improve his family’s quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale prices, such as fruits that are in season.

loans.name: Aicardo De Jesús

texts.es:
Aicardo es un campesino trabajador y humilde, con 60 años de edad, sigue trabajando para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Durante 30 años se ha dedicado a la cría y comercialización de cerdos y ganado de levante, actividad que aprendió por herencia familiar y que le ha permitido generar recursos para salir adelante.
Actualmente solicita su noveno ciclo de crédito con el que desea comprar concentrado para alimentar a sus animales y lograr tener una mejor producción que le permita generar mayor nivel de rentabilidad a la hora de vender.
Aicardo manifiesta que su avanzada edad no es impedimento para seguir realizando la labor que lo apasiona y que le ha dado de comer durante toda su vida, por ello sigue luchando incansablemente para lograr incrementar su ganado porcino y de levante y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ofrecer a sus hijos menores la oportunidad de tener una educación de excelente calidad para que sean unos profesionales íntegros y exitosos.
texts.en:
Aicardo is a humble and hardworking peasant. At the age of sixty, he keeps working in order to cover his family's basic expenses. He has a wife and five children. He has been working raising and selling pigs and cattle for thirty years. He learned this business from his family, and this allowed him to generate enough resources to make a living.

He is currently requesting his ninth loan cycle, which he wishes to use to buy concentrated feed for his animals, so that his production increases and allows him to generate more profit when it comes time to sell.

Aicardo says his old age is not an obstacle for him to keep doing the work he loves and that has provided for him his whole life. That is why he keeps working tirelessly to increase his number of pigs and cattle, so that he can improve his family's quality of life and offer his younger children the opportunity of getting an excellent quality education and becoming upstanding and successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for his animals.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 31-year-old women residing In Punjab, Pakistan. She is lives with her family, which consists of 4 daughters and 2 sons. Basically, her family is poor, and her husband sells hair oil by bicycle.

Her husband wants to purchase different types of hair oils like coconut oil, mustard oil, olive oil, etc., to maintain his client circle and to develop the daily sales and profits.

To help her husband, Rukhsana has requested a KIVA loan. She is very thankful to KIVA and it’s Field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of hair oils like coconut oil, mustard oil, olive oil, etc., for reselling purposes

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is residing in Punjab, Pakistan. She is a simple housewife, with two daughters and a son. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is doing his own business of glass and aluminum fixing at a small-scale. 

Nasreen’s husband needs to purchase various types of glass and aluminum for fixing window panes. Therefore, she has applied for the loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase the necessary products.

She is warmly grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for providing her loan to fulfill her husband’s need.

loans.use: to purchase various types of glass and aluminum for her husband's business.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 41-year-old lady who lives in the Punjab, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family. She has six children and her spouse is a fruit seller in the local market near his residence. This is the only source of income for them. 

She requested the loan from KIVA and its Field Partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase more fruit to sell on the cart so that her husband can increase daily sales.

This loan will also help them to make an improvement in their financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell in the market.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive en casa de sus padres la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de San José de Yunguyo de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel secundaria; se dedica a venta de CDS en una de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Su esposo es albañil y trabaja en diferentes obras en la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construccion (cemento, estuco,arena, fierros y otros)para la construccion de una cocina pequeña en la casa donde vive. Así tendrá mayor comodidad. 
El sueño de Reina es tener una tienda de CDS y a si ofrecer comodidad a toda su familia  y mejor calidad de vida.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Reina is married and has two children. She lives with her parents in the San José de Yunguyo area of the city of El Alto. She only studied up to high school. She sells CDs at one of the fairs in the city of El Alto. Her husband is a mason, and he works on different jobs in city of the El Alto. She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to build a small kitchen, such as cement, plaster, sand, iron, and other items. In this manner, she will be more comfortable. Reina's dream is to own a CD store, and so provide with her family with comfort and a better quality of life. This is the first time that she is applying for a loan together with IMPRO and also with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a kitchen, such as cement, plaster, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fish at wholesale

loans.name: Carmen Violeta

texts.es:
Carmen Violeta tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad cerca al valle del Río Jequetepeque, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, su esposo le apoya en esta labor, Carmen ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 501 para arreglo de su local y de esta manera atender a sus clientes en un lugar agradable.
texts.en:
Carmen Violeta is 55 years of age and lives with her husband in a community in the Zana district, near the Jequetepeque River valley. The populace is dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising. They are located just one hour from the city of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque on Peru's north coast. 

Carmen Violeta's business is selling beer from her store located in her home. Her husband helps with the work. She is requesting a loan of 2,501 new pesos to pay for rearranging her shop to better attend to her customers in a more agreeable ambience.

loans.use: to arrange her store so she can attend to her customers in an agreeable and adequate ambience.

loans.name: Jaime Luis

texts.es:
Jaime es un joven campesino, dedicado a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, además posee diferentes cultivos que le han generado ingresos adicionales y, de manera alterna trabaja como empleado en una tienda de abarrotes, así se gana la vida, para solventar los gastos básicos suyos y de su esposa.
Las labores del campo las aprendió de su padre, quien toda la vida se dedicó a trabajar la tierra y a criar animales. Hoy en día, a sus 25 años de edad, es reconocido por la calidad de los productos que ofrece en el mercado del municipio.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de más lechones y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y mejorar las ventas e ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Jaime tiene como propósito darle continuidad a su actividad generadora de recursos, pues planea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita tomar la decisión para tener hijos en un futuro a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Jaime is a young farmer. He raises and sells pigs for a living. Additionally he has different crops which have generated him additional income. He also works as an employee in a grocery store and earns a living to meet his basic expenses and those of his wife.
He learned farm work from his father who all his life worked the land and raised animals. Today, at 25 years old, he is known for the quality of the products that he offers in the town market.
The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of more piglets and concentrate to feed to the animals. This will allow him to increase his production and improve his sales and income that he receives for his labor.
Jamie has a goal to give continuity to his income generating job, as plans to improve his living conditions to guarantee an economic stability that will allow him to take the decision to have children in the medium term.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and concentrate to feed the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil and rice for business.

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
Gladys es madre soltera de 5 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación.
A sus 47 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en el oficio de la confección a terceros; su pasión por esta labor comenzó desde pequeña al lado de su abuela quien le enseñó las técnicas; cuando creció comenzó a trabajar en diferentes talleres ubicados al sur de la ciudad, allí se capacitó en alta costura y se especializó en corte, confección, diseño y escalado. Ya con toda su experiencia y sus conocimientos, hace un año decidió independizarse y montó su propio taller en un espacio que adecuó en su vivienda; allí presta el servicio a terceros y cuando tiene tiempo y capital de trabajo, saca algunas prendas de línea propia.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de material para sacar producción de leggins y blusas estampadas que se están utilizando mucho por estos tiempos, lo que le permitirá generar más ventas e ingresos para seguir capitalizando su negocio y velar por el bienestar familiar.
Gladys tiene como propósito a mediano plazo, ampliar y fortalecer su negocio a tal punto que pueda generar empleo y que sean sus hijos quienes tomen las riendas de esta microempresa, pues ya los mayores tienen nociones en el tema de la confección y se sienten atraídos por la actividad; esto le ayudará a garantizar una estabilidad económica para mejorar la casa donde reside que se encuentra deteriorada; dando paso para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys is a single mother of 5 children, whom she has raised with great effort and dedication.

At 47 years old, she works making clothing for third parties. Her passion for this work began when she was very young, with her grandmother, who taught her the techniques. When she grew up she began working in different workshops that were located south of the city, where she was trained in haute couture, and specialized in cutting, dressmaking, design, and scale. 

A year ago, already having all her experience and knowledge, she decided to become independent, and she opened her own workshop in a space that she outfitted within her home.  There, she provides service to third parties, and when she has time and working capital, she makes garments from her own line of clothing.

The loan she is seeking is for the purchase of wholesale supplies (fabrics, thread, elastic, lace, and such), which will allow her to have the materials available for producing leggings and patterned blouses, that are very much in use currently.  This way, she can generate more sales and income to continue financing her business and look after the well-being of her family.
 
Gladys has a medium term goal, which is to expand and strengthen her business to the point that it can generate employment, and that it will be her children who would take the reins of this micro-business, since the older ones have some knowledge of dressmaking and feel attracted by the occupation. 

This will help her to guarantee the financial stability to improve the house where she lives, which is deteriorated, making it possible to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies wholesale (fabrics, thread, elastic, lace, and such).

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su familia, madre de dos hijos de 10 y 2 años de edad y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo quedando con toda la carga económica de su familia.
Lleva 3 años dedicada a vender productos por catálogo y mercancía por encargo como lociones y ropa; trabaja todos los días ofreciendo productos, entregando pedidos y cobrando la cartera de sus clientes, cuenta con la ventaja de manejar su propio tiempo y además logra generar ingresos sin descuidar sus hijos.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de promociones de mercancía como perfumería, ropa interior, accesorios, cosméticos y otros productos, lo que le dará la posibilidad de vender más productos, pues tendrá disponible un inventario más variado para satisfacer los gustos y requerimientos de clientela, aumentando el nivel de ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos familiares.
Diana tiene como propósito fortalecer su negocio y aumentar su clientela para que esta actividad generadora de ingresos sea mucho más rentable y le permita brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Diana is an enterprising woman and dedicated to her family. She is the mother of two children, 10 and 2, and head of the household since she separated with her husband, which left her with all the economic burden of the family.

For three years she has sold products through a catalog and custom merchandise like lotions and clothes. She works everyday offering her products, delivering orders and charging customers' accounts, which has the advantage of managing her own time and also generating income without neglecting her children. 

The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise promotions like perfume, underwear, accessories, cosmetics, and other products. It will give her the possibility of selling more products and she will have a much more varied inventory in order to satisfy the tastes and requirements of her clientele. This will increase her level of income in order to meet basic family expenses.

Diana's aim is to strengthen her business and increase her customer base so that this income generating job can be much more profitable and allow her to provide her children a better education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of merchandise like perfume, underwear, accessories, cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Leonor Margarita

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 38 años de edad de estado civil Unida tiene dos hijos vive el espeso y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Leonor se dedica a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el préstamo para  poder comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra y para arrendar terrenos.  Las compras lo realiza en el cantón ventanas.   Su sueño es mejorar su cultivo y la producción para tener una mejor calidad de  vida. El desafío  que enfrenta es combatir contra las malezas.  En su tiempo libre la gusta pasar con su familia.
texts.en:
Leonor is 38 years old, married, and lives with her spouse and children in the Stone Quarry community in Ventanas County of Los Ríos. 

She is a part of the community bank "30 DE NOVIEMBRE," which is located in the Stone Quarry area, and works in agriculture and with livestock. 

Leonor plants corn. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy plant fertilizer and to rent land. She will make these purchases within the Ventanas community. Her dream is to improve her crop production to have a better quality of life. The challenge she faces is fighting back weeds on her land. She likes to spend her free time with family.

loans.use: to buy plant fertilizer.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 53, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a driver and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lourdes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lourdes hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
This is Catherine, 48, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Felipe, a carpenter and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Catherine sells lumber. She gets lumber from a construction firm and sells it for a little profit to customers. She also has a variety store for additional income. She earns a minimum of 3,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more lumber and grocery items for her variety store.

Catherine dreams of being more successful in business and hopes that her family is always in good heath. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber and grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Ernestina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ernestina tiene 43 años de edad  es casada vive con su esposo y sus hijo de 19, 14 y 10 años en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Ernestina se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos y para dar mantenimiento especifico a sus siembras.
Vende sus productos en Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar su vivienda. El desafío que se enfrenta  el mal tiempo. En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 43 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and children (ages 19, 14, and 10) in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  

Ernestina is a member of the November 30th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Mina de Piedra in the canton of Ventanas.  The members are farm workers and livestock breeders.  

Ernestina is a farmer who grows corn.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies so that she can apply specific maintenance treatments to her crops.  Ernestina sells her products in Ventanas.  Her dream is to improve her home.  The challenge she faces is dealing with bad weather.  

In her free time, Ernestina enjoys being with her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and seeds.

loans.name: Andres Eduardo

texts.es:
Andres tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en casa de ellos,vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias.

Andres se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz esta empezando a trabajar en la agricultura. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves.

Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquir algunos insumos.El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas, semillas y una bomba para fumigar. 

La meta es trabajar mucho para tener dinero para seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura. Cuando tiene tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Andres is 20 years old.  He is single and doesn’t have any children.  He lives with his parents in their home in the Mocache Canton, Los Ríos province.  When he has free time he likes to play sports with his friends in the neighborhood.

His communal bank is called 27 de Octubre.  It is located in the Sara Guerrero area of the Mocache Canton, Los Ríos province.

Andres works in agriculture, sowing corn.  He is just getting started in agriculture.  He makes his purchases on Thursdays in Mocache, at the market.

With the money he has asked for, he has been able to take care of his needs such as paying labor costs and getting supplies.  The loan that he asked for is for the purchase of fertilizers, soil amendments, insecticides, seed, and a spray pump.

His goal is to work hard in order to have money to keep investing in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, soil amendments, insecticides, seeds, and a pump for spraying.

loans.name: Eladio Bolivar

texts.es:
Eladio tiene 62 años de edad es soltero tiene cuatro hijos todos casados, vive solo vive en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias. 

Eladio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves. Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquirir algunos insumos. Enfrenta desafios como la competencia y la falta de agua.

El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas liquidos para la maleza. La meta es pedir a dios por la salud para seguir trabajando. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver la television y descanzar.
texts.en:
Eladio is 62 years old and is single. He has four children who are all married. He lives alone in the Mocache canton belonging to the Los Ríos province. The communal bank is called "27 de octubre" [27th October] and is situated in the recinto Sara Guerrero belonging to the Mocache canton. The locals work in agriculture and livestock.

Eladio works in agriculture growing corn. He makes his purchases in Mocache at the Thursday market. With his money he has been able to cover some of his needs such as paying for labour and buying some supplies. The challenges he faces are the competition and the lack of water.

Eladio is asking for the loan to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds and weedkiller. His aim is to ask God for good health so he can continue working. In his free time he likes watching television and relaxing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds and weedkiller.

loans.name: Gulshan's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 38-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. She looks after her family at home. Her husband works in transportation and has his own auto rickshaw.  Her husband is an honest man in the society. He purchased his auto rickshaw five years ago. Due to continuous usage of the rickshaw, some parts are required to repair it, so he needs some money for his auto rickshaw maintenance.

Gulshan is already a BRAC loanee, so she contacted the BRAC Pakistan office for a loan. BRAC staff physically visited her house and collected necessary information about her husband's regularity in driving the auto rickshaw.

BRAC Pakistan issued her a loan for the maintenance of her husband's auto rickshaw.

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase parts required to repair her husband's auto rickshaw

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
36 year old Rocelyn is a hardworking mother who owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been operating this business for five years. She has this business to earn a living and to save for the education of her 4 children.

Rocelyn would like to borrow a loan of 5,000 PHP which will allow her to buy cooking oil, vinegar, bread, snack foods, soft drinks and beverages to sell. In the future, Rocelyn hopes for a comfortable lifestyle and to continue to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to buy oil, vinegar, bread, snack foods, soft drinks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopies and supplies (reams of paper and toner) at wholesale

loans.name: Sope Seydi Djamil Group

texts.fr: SOPEY SEYDI DJAMIL est composé de 12 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. Elles ont les mêmes ambitions et font pratiquement la même activité. Leur présidente s’appelle Ndèye, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Son activité primaire est le commerce, elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des produits alimentaires comme le riz, l’huile et le sucre  et ensuite les revendre à ses clients potentiels. Elle est mariée et mère de famille de 5 enfants. Elle a une activité de 3ans dans son activité. A part ses besoins, elle n’a aucunes charges. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la finir à 14h car dit elle c’est une femme de ménage et elle doit préparer à manger pour ses enfants. A l’avenir elle voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de vente et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: The Sopey Seydi Djamil group is composed of 12 members living inthe same neighborhood and meeting as needed. They have the same goals and run very similar business. Their leader is called Ndeye; she is the one raising her hand in the photo. She works as a vendor. She is requesting this loan in order to buy food products such as rice, vegetable oil and sugar for resale. She is married and the mother of five. She has three years of experience with this business. She has no additional dependents She starts her work day at 9 AM and ends at 2 PM since she is the one running the household and she needs to prepare food for her children. In the future, she would like to open additional sales points and increase her revenues.

loans.use: Acheter des produits alimentaires et les revendre

loans.name: Sana's Group

texts.en:
Sana is a member of a 2 person lending group. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a very hardworking house wife and a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is the only income earning person in the family. He is a milk seller by profession. For the last twelve years he has been in the dairy business. He purchases milk and produces yogurt, cheese and butter, and sells them at a profitable price in the main market.

Currently her husband has insufficient savings to purchase more milk to continue his business. Therefore, in order to help her husband, Sana has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan amount would be helpful for her husband to purchase more milk to continue his business. By doing so he can continue generating income to meet the family's daily needs. 

With the help of the profits, Sana wants to save money for her children's education. She is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: In the picture Sana raises her hand.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products like phones, recharge cards for adding minutes, and chargers for his business

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está trabajando y luchando por salir adelante, todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una.
Marina, se dedica a la cría y la venta de gallinas y huevos,  también se debe destacar el trabajo que ella hace por poder crecer y salir adelante para ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Alimentos para sus gallinas ponedoras, vitaminas y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y mas venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is working and fighting to get ahead. All the women are part of the poverty elimination program. Each one is doing a survey on the elimination of poverty in order to know their situations.
Marina raises and sells chickens and eggs. She does what she does so that she can grow and get ahead to help her family.
Marina is requesting this loan for the purchase of vitamins and feed for her laying hens, and other items. This will help her to obtain greater production and sales, and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed, vitamins, and other items.

loans.name: Loremil

texts.en:
This is Loremil, 36, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Arturo, a foreman and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Loremil operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Loremil dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Trigal 2 Group

texts.es:
Trigal dos es este grupo formado en Ciudad del Este. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que se unieron con el propósito de crecer y mejorar cada una con lo que hace. Todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les ayudará a conocer en qué situación está cada una y conforme a eso poder trabajar y mejorar, para poder superar su pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Santa, quien es una persona muy humilde, ella hizo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que mostró que estaba con ingresos muy bajos, pero ella continua trabajando y luchado por mejorar ese resultado. Ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, ya sea para mate o tereré (bebidas tradicionales paraguayas), y comenta que si bien su trabajo es muy humilde, está orgullosa de lo que hace, pues le permite ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertir en su emprendimiento, que es para comprar remedios para la venta, y así poco a poco ir mejorando.
texts.en:
Trigal 2 is the group shown, based in Ciudad del Este. All the women are friends and neighbours in this city, and they came together with the goal of growing and improving in what they do. All are taking part in a poverty elimination survey which will help them to understand each individual's situation, and work and improve based on the results, in order to break out of poverty. 

Santa is one of the group members, and is a very humble person. She did the poverty elimination survey, and it showed that she has a very low income. Nevertheless, she continues to work and fight to improve her situation. She earns a living by selling natural medicines, including mate and tereré (a traditional Paraguayan drink). She says that even though her work is modest, she is proud of what she does, as it allows her to help her family.

Santa is requesting this loan to invest in her business by buying medicines to sell, and thus continue improving gradually.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Tierra Fertil  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Tierra Fértil está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven en por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeada mucha vegetación y verdes campos, tiene un clima frió, una arquitectura variada. Su gente es amable y gentil, a pesar de todas las dificultades del diario vivir siempre están con una sonrisa.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 4 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Blanca desde hace 2 años se dedica a la atención de una tienda que es de su propiedad labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, en su local tiene servicio de  internet, bazar y papelería. 
Su nuevo crédito es para comprar víveres y útiles escolares para su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The loan group Tierra Fértil (Fertile Land) consists of eight women who live on the outskirts of the Valle parish in Cuenca, a place that is surrounded by much vegetation and green fields. It has a cold climate and a varied architecture. Its people are friendly and gracious; in spite of all the difficulties of daily living, they always have a smile.

One of the members of this group is Señora Blanca. She is 30 years old. She is the single mother of a 4-year-old girl, who goes to a little city school. She does not have her own house, and so she rents.

For two years Doña Blanca has tended her own store. She works every day of the week without a fixed schedule. In her shop, she has internet service, a variety store, and a stationery store.

Her new loan will be used to buy groceries and school supplies for her business. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy groceries and school supplies for her business

loans.name: Génesis Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Génesis está integrado por 18 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y de esa forma luchando por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir, con ingresos medios, pero trabajando y esforzándose día a día por poder mejorar y salir adelante. Ella es costurera, ama de llaves y también niñera, lo que demuestra que es una persona muy luchadora y por sobre todo trabajadora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás, para poder seguir con sus costuras y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, called Génesis, is made up of 18 women. All of them are friends and neighbors from the city of Villa Elisa. They are all part of the poverty elimination program, and have done the poverty elimination survey, and in this way they are fighting to improve their lives. 

One of the members is Maria, who in her last survey demonstrated a poverty ranking of "level two" (see below), which means she has a mid-level income, but is working and striving day-to-day to be able to improve her conditions and get ahead.

She is a seamstress, a housekeeper, and a nanny, which shows that she is a fighter and above all a hard worker who wants to get ahead. She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of fabrics, thread, buttons and more, in order to continue doing her sewing and filling her clients´ orders.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread, buttons and more

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Sagrada Familia” está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas están con mucho entusiasmo de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y poder superar su situación de pobreza, es por eso que también forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza.
Nilda es parte de este grupo, y ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que está luchando por sus seres queridos, que son quienes la inspiran a seguir luchando. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y comenta que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela gracias a la buena calidad de sus prendas.
Nilda pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para este verano, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Sagrada Familia" is in its first loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees.  All of the members have a lot of enthusiasm for improving their living conditions and getting out of poverty.  This is why they are taking part in the Poverty Elimination Program.

Nilda is part of this group.  She is a very hardworking woman who is fighting hard for her loved ones, who are her inspiration to continue to strive for progress.  She has a business selling a variety of garments.  She says that she has developed a very good customer base, thanks to the good quality of her garments.

Nilda is requesting a loan to invest in a variety of clothing for this summer so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to sell

loans.name: Pa Bong 1 Group

texts.en:
This is Hoa, who is 24 years old.  She is married with one child, who attends school.  Hoa runs an agriculture business raising pigs and cultivating rice. She said her main challenge is the lack of capital. 

Hoa has requested a loan of VND 5,000,000 to buy a lawn mower, fertilizer and corn seeds. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her income so that she can cover her child's tuition fee and rebuild her old house. In the future Hoa plans to buy more buffaloes to further expand her business. She hopes to generate higher profits and sustain her family's daily needs. 

Hoa is the team leader of Pa Bong 1 Group which consists of 13 Thai ethnic minority women. In the picture, Hoa stands at the first from the right.  Note that the man standing third from the left of the picture is the guarantor of one of the borrower (Ms. Nhung).

loans.use: to buy a lawn mower, fertilizer and corn seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to buy an industrial mixer, a scale, and wholesale supplies (flour, sugar, baking powder, margarine, and eggs, 
among others).

loans.name: Enor Jamueth

texts.es:
Enor, a sus 37 años de edad se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos y, de manera alterna trabaja como empleado en una tienda de abarrotes, así se gana la vida, para solventar los gastos básicos suyos y de su esposa.
Las labores del campo las aprendió de sus familiares, pues ha sido una tradición que pasa de generación en generación.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de más lechones y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y mejorar las ventas e ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Enor tiene como propósito darle continuidad a su actividad generadora de recursos, ampliando su capacidad instalada para poder tener más producción y generar una mayor rentabilidad, que le permita independizarse completamente y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Enor is 37 years old and raises and sells pigs for a living. He also works as an employee at a grocery store as an alternative way to meet his basic needs and those of his wife.
He learned farm work from his family, as it has been a tradition that passes from generation to generation.
The requested credit will be invested in the purchase of piglets and concentrate to feed the animals. This will allow him to increase his production and improve his sales and income that he earns from his labor.
Enor's goal is to give himself continuity in his income generating activity, increasing his capacity to be able to have more production and generate greater profit. This is will allow him to be completely independent and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and concentrate to feed the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (pastries, grain, dairy products, chips, coffee, sodas, etc.)

loans.name: Astrid Yamile

texts.es:
Astrid es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, que se ha criado en el campo, donde su padre le enseñó a cuidar la tierra y los animales; a sus 26 años de edad, se encuentra estudiando una técnica ambiental semipresencial, con la cual ha ampliado sus conocimientos sobre agricultura y el cuidado del medio ambiente; esto la motiva para iniciar su propio negocio; un pequeño vivero que estará ubicado en la finca donde reside, allí cuenta con la ventaja de poseer algunas plantas ya sembradas y además la finca queda al borde de la carretera, lo que facilitará la visibilidad para los viajeros que transiten por allí; además ya tiene algunos clientes que le están encargando plantas ornamentales; para lograr su objetivo, Astrid solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (semillas, abonos, tierra, musgo, entre otros) y materiales para construir el invernadero (madera y plásticos), esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar buenos resultados para aportar a la economía familiar.
Astrid es consciente que para lograr la meta propuesta, debe trabajar arduamente, con esmero, disciplina y mucha dedicación, así podrá acreditar poco a poco su vivero para que, en un futuro a mediano plazo pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y ayudar a que otras personas mejoren su calidad de vida, así como ella mejorará la suya con su oficio.
texts.en:
Astrid is enterprising and dynamic. She grew up in the country, where her father taught her how to cultivate the earth and look after animals. She is 26 years old, and is studying an environmental technical degree that includes both on-campus classes and classes by distance. Her studies have increased her knowledge of agriculture and of care for the environment. This has motivated her to start her own business, which is a small nursery that will be located on the property where she lives. She has the advantage of already having planted some plants on this property, as well as the fact that the property borders the road, which will increase the visibility of her business for people who pass by. In addition, she already has some customers who have ordered ornamental plants from her.

To achieve her objective, Astrid is requesting this loan to buy agricultural inputs at wholesale prices, such as seeds, fertilizer, soil and moss, as well as to buy materials with which to build a greenhouse, such as wood and plastic. This will allow her to start her business, with which she hopes to achieve good results so she can contribute to her family’s finances.

Astrid understands that to achieve her goal, she must work very hard, with a lot of care, discipline and dedication. She hopes to gradually establish a good reputation for her nursery, so that in the medium-term future she can create employment opportunities and help other people improve their quality of life, as well as her own.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs at wholesale prices, such as seeds, fertilizer, soil and moss, as well as to buy materials with which to build a greenhouse, such as wood and plastic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and concentrate to feed his animals

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is a 36-year-old farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married and has three children ages 5, 7 and 11. Nilo works hard in his farm and hopes to prosper from this business. He is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pay for labor of four people. The loan will give him a chance to continue doing his business while also providing for his family.

In the future, he hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor of four people

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 47-year-old who has a motorcycle transport business, but her primary source of income comes from farming. The couple would like to keep their transportation in good condition in order to minimize any unnecessary incidents during daily travel.  Now, Agnes is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP for exterior repairs necessary of their motorcycle transport. Hopefully, they will maintain its stability and improve their financial situation and living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase parts and pay for the exterior repair of her motorcycle transport

loans.name: Neftali Armando

texts.es:
Neftali de 70 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de los cuales ambos están casados  y ya no viven con él hace un par de años, su esposa falleció de una enfermedad respiratoria  y ahora solo vive con una nieta.


Él se a dedicado toda su vida al cultivo de maíz  desde que era muy pequeño, sus padres dejaron de mandarlo a la escuela y mandarlo al trabajo y ahora también tiene una vaca la cual cuida para sacarle provecho de la leche.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz lo cual no es tan fácil por la época de verano, porque son siembras de regadillo le toca andar acarreando agua por tuberías de PVC  y para ello necesita el crédito para  sacar la cosecha que solo sera posible con la ayuda del crédito.  

El Señor Neftali tiene como sueño poder cultivar 28,000 metros cuadrdaos de tierra mas,  le ayudaría en sus ingresos ya que no puede hacer las actividades como cuando tenia 60 años, pues para el próximo año necesitara la ayuda de algunos campesinos.
texts.en:
Neftali, 70 years old, has two children who are both married and haven't lived with him for a couple of years now. His wife died of a respiratory illness and he now only lives with one granddaughter.

He has worked his whole life growing corn, ever since he was very young, when his parents stopped sending him to school and sent him to work. He now also has a cow, which he looks after as it provides him with milk.

Neftali is requesting this loan in order to plant 14,000 square metres of corn. This isn't too easy during the summertime, because corn is an irrigated crop and he'll need to walk around carrying water in PVC piping. He needs the loan for this reason, in order to harvest his crops, which will only be possible with the help of this loan.

Señor Neftali's dream is to be able to grow 28,000 more square metres of land. This would help him in his earnings, since he can't work the way he did when he was 60 years old, and next year he will need the help of some farmers.

loans.use: to plant 14,000 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase paint for his home and to pay for repairs to the bathroom

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is a 43-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has four children. Her eldest is 19 and the youngest is five. For eight years now, she has been engaged in a Sari-sari store business selling basic household commodities. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy 2 sacks of rice, liquor, beer, soft drinks, shampoo, milk, coffee, bath soap, sugar, cooking oil, soy sauce and kerosene. 

She hopes that with the loan she can replenish her inventory, thus, increasing her business profits.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice, liquor, beer, soft drinks, shampoo, milk,  coffee, bath soap, sugar, cooking oil, soy sauce and kerosene

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en: Rodelia is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her family in Buguey. She sells dried fish as her family's source of income. She has been doing this for three years and she is able to earn PHP 300 daily, which is not enough to cover all their household expenses. Right now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. She hopes to obtain this loan so she can attain higher profits, which will go toward their daily needs and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es:
Amilcar de 56 años de edad, se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos usados, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia en ese mercado, él es casado su esposa, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y se preocupa por mantener su casa limpia y que a sus hijos no les falte nada. Ellos dos son padres de 4 hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en  Estados Unidos y son los que le apoyan económicamente y su hija la menor se encuentra estudiando en una universidad,  su hijo penúltimo se dedica  al comercio de vehículos junto a su papá.

Amilcar expresa que aprendió de su padre, que se dedicaba a la misma actividad. Ademas, de esa fuente de ingreso él se dedica a la venta de joyas de acero, negocio en el cual lleva 3 años de experiencia, y es en este negocio en el cual esta involucra su esposa y su hija.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar una deuda pendiente en un banco.

 Amilcar pretende en un futuro mejorar el negocio de compra y venta de vehículos, tiene planes de montar su propio auto-lote y de esta manera tendrá mejores ganancias y podrá asegurar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Amilcar, 56, makes a living by buying and selling used vehicles. He has 15 years of experience in this market. He is married and his wife is in charge of domestic tasks; she makes sure that the house is clean and that her children have everything they need. They have four children, two of whom are in the United States and support them financially. Their youngest daughter is studying in college. Their second youngest daughter works by selling vehicles with her father.

Amilcar learned from his father, who did the same work as Amilcar does now. In addition to this work, he sells steel jewelry, a business in which he has three years experience. His wife and daughter are also involved in this business.

He is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to pay off an debt pending with a bank. In the future, Amilcar hopes to improve his business buying and selling used cars. He has plans to open his own car lot to increase his profits and ensure a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to make his home more comfortable with personal expenses that will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima was born in 1967. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour with her six sons and daughters and her husband who works in agriculture. One of her sons is in the military. 

Fatima has been supporting her husband financially by running her business selling home products and furniture for two years. She started it with a small quantity of items. Now she needs to expand her project by purchasing a larger quantity of home products and furniture in order to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products and furniture for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Desde el año 2012, Carmen emprendió su negocio de ofrecer servicios de mensajería  trabajando diariamente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, para ello empezó su tarea generadora de ingresos con familiares y amigos y con mucho esfuerzo hoy ha logrado extenderla, no solo en su propio barrio, sino también en zonas aledañas. Su meta es contar con más trabajadores, ampliando su negocio y a futuro comprar su propia casa, por lo pronto está siempre dispuesta a satisfacer las expectativas de su clientela para surgir mucho más. Hoy Carmen necesita modernizar un poco más su negocio y requiere un computador y un escritorio, con el cual mejoraría su atención desde su punto de contacto con el cliente. Esa es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual responderá a esta necesidad y con ello impactar su potencial de ventas, generando un poco de mas ingresos.
texts.en: In 2012 Carmen started the business of offering messaging services, working every day from 6 in the morning to 8 at night. She started offering this service to relatives and friends, and created a source of income. With a lot of effort her business is now extended not only to her own neighborhood, but also to neighboring communities. Her goal is to have more employees and broaden her business; and in the future to buy her own house. Therefore, she is always ready to satisfy her clientele's expectations to grow even more. Currently Carmen needs to bring her business up to date and therefore, she needs a computer and a desk, with which she would improve her services at her business location. This is why she is requesting a credikiva loan, her first request to the "Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo", with which she will fulfill her needs and improve her potential sales, generating some more income.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a desk

loans.name: Lucia Abigail

texts.es:
Lucía Narvaez vive en San Miguel de los Bancos más conocido como el Cantón del Amor, el mismo que se encuentra en la Provincia de Pichincha al noroccidente de la Ciudad de Quito, el clima de este hermoso Cantón es cálido húmedo y como tradición tienen las festividades con comparsas y artistas que se realiza por el aniversario del mismo. La parroquia de Mindo es una parroquia netamente turística, sus habitantes son muy humildes y trabajadores con una gran acogida a los turistas nacionales y extranjeros que van a visitar los diferente sitios de descanso y los distintos atractivos como lo es en cánopi y muchos deportes extremos. 
En esta parroquia vive la señora Lucia Narvaez, una mujer luchadora de 24 años, ella es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos el primero tiene 3 años y el ultimo 2, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos, aprendió de este negocio cuando estaba en el colegio ya que estudio agropecuaria, trabaja un promedio de 11 horas diarias entre su negocio y el trabajo que tiene como coordinadora de un programa de intercambio este préstamo lo invertirá para la ampliación física y productiva del negocio. Con esta inversión espera que su nivel de vida mejore ya que podrá incrementar su actividad productiva. 
La señora Lucia agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, better known as the Cantón of love itself, is found in the province of Pichincha, northwest of the city of Quito.  The climate of beautiful Cantón is humid and warm.   As traditions, they have festivities with parades and artists that occur on the anniversary of the city proper.  They have a parish Mindo, a purely touristic one.  Its inhabitants are very humble and hard-working, with a great reception of national tourists and foreigners that come to visit the different rest areas and the various attractions. 

In this parish lives Lucia, a tough 24 year old woman, who is the single mother of 2 children.  The older child is 3 years old and the younger one is 2 years old. She is dedicated to raising pio chickens.  She learned about this business when she was in high school, having studied agriculture.  She works an average of 11 hours a day, between her business and the work she does as a coordinator of an exchange program.  She will invest this loan for the physical expansion and production expansion of the business.
