Mustafokhuja is a farmer from a village in the Vakhsh region. He is 53 years old, and a family man with two sons and three daughters. Mustafokhuja has a long-term lease on 5 hectares of land, on which he grows wheat, cotton and a garden.

The income from his farming business is his family's only income. Mustafokhuja has been a farmer for 10 years. He inherited his vocation from his father. Mustafokhuja likes working on the land and seeing the results of his labor. Now he is taking a loan to buy fertilizer, fuel and cotton seed. He will prepare the land for planting. In a month he will start to sow cotton. Mustafokhuja hopes for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel and cotton seed.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor was born in 1980. She is married and lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Her husband works in a perfume store. Noor has been helping her husband financially by running her business of selling clothes for the past year. She started the business with a small quantity of clothes. Now, she needs to expand by purchasing a larger quantity of clothes, adding children's clothes and accessories, to increase her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Berta, es casada, tiene 27 años de edad, con el afán de apoyar en los gastos de su hogar ella se dedica a vender variedad de mariscos, es un oficio que lo aprendió de su familia ya posee 10 años de experiencia.
Comprara mariscos para vender y satisfacer a sus clientes, espera que su negocio este bien surtido y de esta manera podrá tener los ingresos que necesita para apoyar en los gastos familiares y cancelar sus deudas.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio así como también reforzar su economía con mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Berta is 27 years old and married. To help with household expenses, she works selling a variety of seafood. She learned this work from her family, and she now has 10 years of experience in it.

She will buy seafood to sell and meet her customers' needs. She would like to keep her business well stocked so that she can earn the income she needs to help with household expenses and to pay off debts. Her dream is to improve her business, her income and her family’s finances.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell.

loans.name: Fredys

texts.es:
Fredys de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta 9°, está acompañado, su compañera de vida le ayuda y también administra un negocio de ventas de artículos de hojalatería, sus hijos viven en su casa, depende 5 personas de él,  3 de sus hijos mayores estudian, 2 van al instituto y el otro está en 9° grado. 


Él posee un negocio de venta de artículos de hojalatería que el mismo hace y también un trabajo que hace a quien lo busque, hace candiles, canales, jarrillas cubetas, cumbos para molinos, chimeneas y latas para panaderías  etc. tiene 13 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, el trabajo donde fabrica estos materiales lo tiene en su casa. Para comprar los materiales, tiene que viajar  a la  ciudad que está a 1 hora en bus. Su esposa y sus hijos le ayudan en sus tiempos libres, ya que los mayores estudian. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar materiales, como láminas y herramientas, porque en  esta época del año aumenta su trabajo, sus ingresos incrementan y podrá satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

Su deseo es que sus hijos estudien y  puedan sacar una carrera universitaria y con el tiempo poner más ventas o negocios en la ciudad,  en el cual poder aumentar la producción y sus ingresos y que la familia tenga un patrimonio y un trabajo en el cual puedan generar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fredys is 49 years old and has a ninth-grade education. He is married, and his spouse helps him. He runs a business selling products made of sheet metal. His children live in his home; five people depend on him. Three of his older children are in school; two go to high school and the other is in ninth grade.

He has a business selling sheet metal articles that he makes himself and he also does work to order. He makes oil lamps, gutters, coffee pots, buckets, receptacles for mills, chimneys, and tins for bakeries, etc. He has been earning his living this way for 13 years. The shop where he fabricates these products is located in his house. To buy materials, he has to travel to the city, which is an hour away by bus. His wife and his children help him in their free time, since the older children are in school.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy materials like sheet metal and tools because his workload and his income increase at this time of year, allowing him to satisfy his family's needs. 

His desire is for his children go to school and earn a university degree. With time, he would also like to have more sales and business in the city so that he can increase his production and his income in order for his family to have assets and jobs so that they can generate their incomes.

loans.use: to purchase materials like sheet metal and tools because his workload and his income increase at this time of year, allowing him to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en: Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, married, and is a father of a single child. Mouhammad is the only provider for the family.  Mouhammad owns a garage where he specializes in fixing the damaged body parts of a vehicle. He has been in this field since 1995 and has gained much experience. Mouhammad is well known in the neighborhood since he is the only person with such a profession in the surrounding areas. Mouhammad is requesting a loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his garage by installing new blocks on the floor of his garage, and to buy some basic assets. Mouhammad is aiming to continue providing his family with a better standard of living, by improving the quality of his work and increasing his profits.

loans.use: to renovate his garage by installing new blocks on the floor of his garage, and to buy some basic assets.

loans.name: Rokonka

texts.en:
Rokonka is 40 years old and married. He supports a family of five children. He is a mixed crop farmer in Narok County and has been in this business for the last nine years, with a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He is servicing his fifth loan of KES 70,000 from VisionFund Kenya. This will facilitate the purchase of fertilizer and other farm inputs.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His dream is to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 45 years old and from Kakamega County. He is married to Mary, who sells vegetables in the same county. They have eight children from 3 to to 16 years old.

He sells cereals, a business he has run for the last 11 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 17,300. He is taking his fifth loan of KES 40,000 through VisionFund Kenya which he intends to use to expand his business. Part of the loan will be used to educate his children. 

The anticipated proceeds will be used to provide the basic needs for his family and add more shares to VisionFund Kenya. His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of cereal like maize and beans and cassava.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 51 years old, married to Esther and they have been blessed with four children. He runs a hotel business in Kitengela town and has been in this business for five years. His monthly income is KES 30,000. His spouse does not have a source of income at the moment.

He plans to use this loan to buy more flour, sugar and rice for use in his hotel business. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

This is his second loan and he paid his previous loan successfully. In the future, Robert hopes to be successful in his business and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy more flour and rice.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 46 years of age, married and has six children. Her husband works as a government employee. Marivic’s priority in life is to gain greater income for the education of her children. She always tells her children that she doesn’t have any treasure to give, aside from education, because she believes that education is the key to success. 

Marivic is engaged in a retailing business. She always dreams of the growth of her business and of being able to increase her profits. 

Marivic believes that by borrowing a loan of PHP 10,000, she will be able to improve her business. She will use her loan to purchase grocery items like food seasonings, canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste and soap. 

She will do her best to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like food seasonings, canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste and soap to re-stock her general store.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta, es una mujer que se dedica a la venta de lácteos, ya tiene 3 años de tener este negocio, se ubica en el mercado municipal de su localidad y es apoyada por sus hijos, emprendió este negocio debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos extras para dar apoyo a sus hijos en los estudios, ella tiene 45 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos.
Invertirá en la compra de quesos y crema, para tener suficiente producto y poder cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes, espera fortalecer el negocio para conseguir aumentar sus ganancias y cancelar la deuda adquirida, así como también dar apoyo a su familia.
Aspira a tener un negocio más grande y continuar cubriendo los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Berta sells dairy products, an activity she has been engaged in for 3 years already. Her stall is located in the town market of her community and her children help her. She started this activity because she needed an extra income to pay for the education of her children. She is 45 years old and she lives with her two children.
She will invest the loan in the purchase of cheese and cream in order to have enough products to meet her customers’ requests. She hopes to strengthen her activity to succeed in increasing her income and in paying off her contracted debt as well as in supporting her family.
She wants to own a bigger shop and to keep on paying for her family’s expenses.

loans.use: To buy cheese and cream.

loans.name: Mairamkan

texts.ru: Майрамкан 71 год, вдова, одна воспитала 7 детей, все дети женаты, проживают отдельно, самый старший сын живет с Майрамкан, помогает ей по хозяйству. Майрамкан - пенсионерка, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Майрамкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 34 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 2 теленка, 4 козы, 25 овец, а также обрабатывают небольшой земельный надел, на котором сажают картофель и кукурузу. Имеются все необходимые условия для содержания скота. Заготовлено: 300 снопов кукурузы, 600 снопов сена, 500 кг кукурузы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Майрамкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Mairamkan is a 71-year-old widow, who raised seven children herself. All her kids are married and living separately. The oldest son lives with Mairamkan, and helps her with the farm. She is a pensioner, and her main income is from raising livestock. 

She started this trade 34 years ago, by buying cattle for 1,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has five dairy cows, two calves, four goats and 25 sheep. She also has a small plot of land on which she grows potatoes and corn. She has everything needed for her livestock. She has harvested 300 sheaves of corn, 600 sheaves of hay and 500 kg. of corn. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS. 

To expand her farm, Mairamkan took a loan from Bai-Tushum and Partners micro-finance to buy calves for breeding. She plans to invest in expanding her herd with the extra income.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed was born in 1976. She is married with six children and lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Madaba. Her husband works as a driver. Taghreed has been helping her husband financially by running her business of selling clothes and towels for the past year. She started the business with a small quantity of clothes. Now she needs to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of clothes and towels to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and towels to sell

loans.name: Wajiha's Group

texts.en:
Wajiha is 28, and is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a married woman, with one baby. She got proper training as a beautician, and she has been running her own beauty saloon for the past three years. She has regular and punctual clients, as her previous Brac record showed.

She is popular due to her good work in this field. That is why the number of her clients increases day by day.

Keeping in mind her current number of clients, she requires more saloon items, i.e; some plastic furniture for sitting, cosmetic items like facial creams, hair dressers, a steamer, nail polish, scrubs, masks, hair colors, makeover kit, etc...

She made contact with Brac Pakistan for a loan so that she would be able to upgrade items for her beauty saloon. In this way, she will be able to provide better services to her clients and get more income for her services.

After physical verification of her enterprise, Brac Pakistan issued a loan to Wajiha for getting cosmetics and plastic furniture. 
 
Wajiha is very thankful the Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and plastic furniture for her salon.

loans.name: Eduardo Isai

texts.es:
Eduardo, es un padre dedicado al cuido de su pequeño hijo de dos años, la responsabilidad del cuido del niño es completamente de él, para cubrir los gastos familiares se dedica a vender ropa para ambos sexos lo hace de 6:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m, este horario lo maaneja cuando no esta trabajando, también es empleado en una empacadora de carne es ahi donde fue tomada su foto.
Para aprovechar la época navideña solicita capital para comprar faldas, camisas, blusas y pantalones, ya que los clientes empiezan a tener una mayor demanda, espera aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio para tener los recursos económicos que le permitan darle a su hijo un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a father who is dedicated to caring for his little son who is two years old.

He has complete responsibility for his son’s care, and to cover the family expenses he sells clothing for both sexes. He does this from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., which is a schedule that he manages when he is not working; he is also employed in a meat packing plant, and it is there that his photo was taken.

In order to take advantage of the Christmas season, he is seeking capital to purchase skirts, shirts, blouses, and pants, as customer demand is increasing, and he hopes to increase his sales and improve his finances.  

He dreams of expanding his business in order to have the economic resources that will enable him to give his son a better future.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, shirts, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Meliza Catherinne

texts.en:
Meliza wants to work in the hospitality industry. Meliza is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree in hospitality. She plans on graduating in December 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Meliza plans on spending the loan towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Meliza hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. 

With a career in hospitality, she expects to earn $17 a day. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Meliza is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Meliza's father works as a salesman, and his salary is the family's primary source of income. 

Meliza currently works as an event coordinator to help her afford her school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Feda

texts.en:
Feda was born in 1988. She is married, and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband and her two daughters. 

Feda has been supporting her husband financially to cover her daughters’ needs by running her project of selling hand crafts for the past year. She started her project making small hand crafts. Then she started to make crafts in different sizes. 

Now she needs to buy a larger quantity of the needed tools to make her crafts to raise her productivity and sales. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make more crafts

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is an Iraqi youth client who is 24 years old, single, and living with his parents and his three younger brothers. 

Haydar helps his father in providing the family income. He owns a grocery store where he sells all the basic needs for a family, like dairy products, snacks, canned food, and detergent. He established his business in 2009, and has gained much experience in this field. Thanks to his special customer service, Haydar's reputation grew and he became well-known in the neighborhood. 

Haydar is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD to pay the annual rent of his grocery store, and to increase his inventory. 

Haydar is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may continue providing for his family’s needs and improving their living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his grocery store and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en:
Olympia is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of 10 children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in rice farming, food vending and selling beauty products. She is used to working hard because of her children. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, and to pay for labor and tuition fees. In the future, she hopes for more business success in order to provide for her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor and tuition fees

loans.name: Giovanny Andres

texts.es:
El es Giovanny Andrés, el motivo principal de esta carta es contar su pequeña pero extensa vida… Es estudiante de Campo alto, cursa en el programa ensamble, programación y mantenimiento de Hardware, le gusta mucho esa carrera y lo motiva a seguir adelante con sus estudios. Ahora, en la actualidad lamentablemente no tiene como sostener a el papá y a si mismo, ya que vive con el papa y lastimosamente no tienen ninguno un trabajo estable, el único trabajo es en un bar solo los viernes y trabaja de 11:30 a 3 de la mañana de los sábados, no tiene un sueldo fijo, además de eso el papá trabaja en las noches en un carro ambulante vendiendo variedad de comestibles empacados, en este momento más que nunca están pasando por una situación difícil, a el papá le quitaron su único medio de trabajar… bueno, siguiendo con su historia el no tiene un solvento económico de ninguna índole y por supuesto no quiere perder la oportunidad que con tanto esfuerzo logro (la de estudiar) para el desde que salio del colegio en el año 2008 fue algo primordial en estar en una universidad, porque sabe y esta convencido que si se estudia se llega muy lejos, y eso es lo que el quiere, ser un Gran Ingeniero de sistemas porque es lo que le apasiona, por este motivo no quiere que su esfuerzo sea en vano y el agradecería si kva le puede ayudar a pagar sus estudios. 

 Muchas gracias por su atención prestada.
texts.en:
This is Giovanny Andrés, and the primary motivation for this letter is to recount his short but full life. He is a student at Campo Alto, studying Hardware Assembly, Programming and Maintenance. He likes his degree program and is motivated to continue his studies. Unfortunately he does not have enough [money] right now to sustain both his father and himself, being that he lives with his father and does not have a stable job. The only work he has is bartending on Friday nights, when he works from 11:30 p.m. until 3 a.m. on Saturdays and does not earn a fixed amount. His father works nights, selling a variety of packaged foods. Now, more than ever, they are in a tough situation because his father lost his job. 

Well, to continue the story, Giovanny Andrés doesn’t have solvent income of any sort and of course he does not want to lose the opportunity to study which he has worked so hard for, ever since finishing high school in 2008. For him, attending university felt like something primordial because he knows and is convinced that if you study you can go far, and what he wants is to be a great systems engineer. This is what he is passionate about and because of this he does not want all of his efforts so far to have been in vain. He would be grateful if Kiva could help him pay for his studies.

Thank you for your attention.

loans.use: to pay for his education.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.en:
Becoming a medical technician has always been Paola's dream. To achieve her goal, Paola has enrolled in the Universidad Nuestra Senora de La Paz. She expects to graduate in December 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. 

Paola shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. Paola plans on using the loan funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz. 

Paola currently works 40 hours a week as a secretary and earns $14 a day, but making time for school and work has been her biggest challenge. With a degree, she expects to earn $20 a day. 

With one younger brother and one younger sister, Paola hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, es una madre soltera que lucha por sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, a sus 48 años de edad ya tiene 12 años dedicándose a la venta de ropa, atiende su negocio todos los días, es u oficio que aprendió de su familia, sus hijos después de salir de sus clases la apoyan en atender a los clientes.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa apara damas y niños, en variedad de colores, estilos y tallas, para que mantener la fidelidad de los clientes, espera aprovechar al máximo al máximo estas épocas de fin de año y tener mejores ganancias.
Su objetivo es fortalecer su negocio, continuar brindando a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Blanca is a single mother who struggles to get her three children ahead.  She is 48 years old, and she has been selling clothes for 12 years.  She tends to her business every day.  It is a trade that she learned from her family.  After their classes, her children help her tend to the customers.

She will use the requested loan to buy a variety of colors, styles, and sizes of new clothes for women and children.  She will do this in order to keep her customers’ loyalty.  She hopes to take maximum advantage of this end of the year season and to have better income.

Her objective is to strengthen her business, to continue providing her family with a better lifestyle, and to pay her debts.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan has always dreamt of working in forestry. To achieve his goal, Ivan has enrolled in the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi. He expects to graduate in December 2014, but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue to afford his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Ivan shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. Ivan plans on using this loan to pay for his tuition. With a degree in environmental evaluation, he expects to earn $14 a day. 

Unfortunately, Ivan's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, their finances were always tight. With seven other siblings, Ivan is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. To help afford his school and living expenses, Ivan currently works as a mason.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson, a 48-year-old married father of 12, operates a retail shop in Kasese, Uganda. He also sells eggs and timber for additional income. Price fluctuations  and inadequate capital affect his income. Jackson started these businesses to support his family, as he hopes to educate his children and build rental accommodations. He is requesting a loan to buy more sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar to resell.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es una mujer amable y carismática, a sus 53 años de edad se dedica a atender su propio negocio; un café internet y miscelánea que montó por la necesidad de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar, ya que toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella, luego de la separación con su esposo.
El establecimiento nació como una pequeña papelería, con poco surtido y día a día fue tomando fuerza y acreditándose hasta convertirse en lo que es hoy en día; allí presta el servicio de sala de internet, papelería, vende variedades y detalles para toda ocasión, adicionalmente vende fritos y gaseosas en horas de la noche para complementar los ingresos para dar el alimento a sus hijos y satisfacer las necesidades del hogar.
Solicita el apoyo del crédito para inyectar capital de trabajo a su negocio, requiere comprar surtido al por mayor (productos de papelería, tarjetería, bolsas de regalo, entre otros), así podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y mejorar las ganancias en esta temporada decembrina.
Consuelo tiene como propósito seguir acreditando su negocio, con más variedad de surtido y así generar una rentabilidad que le permita apoyar a sus hijos con la crianza y la educación de sus nietos; además desea ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a kind and charismatic woman. She is 53 years old and makes a living from her own business: an internet café she set up out of the need to generate income to settle her household expenses since after separating from her husband the entire economic burden has rested on her.

The establishment began as a small stationery store with little stock. Day after day she was putting in effort and establishing a reputation to convert it into what it is today. There she offers the use of the internet and sells stationery and little gifts for every occasion, and she also sells fried food and soft drink at night to complement her earnings so she can feed her children and satisfy the needs of her household.

She is requesting the support of the loan in order to inject working capital into her business. She needs to purchase stock wholesale (stationery, card-making products, gift bags, etc.) so she is able to satisfy the needs of her clients and improve profits in the December season.

Consuelo’s aim is to continue improving the reputation of her business with more variety of stock and thereby generate profitability, which will allow her to support her children with the raising and education of her grandchildren. She also wishes to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase stock wholesale (stationery, card-making supplies, gift bags, etc.)

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra dreams of working in business administration, but she knows it may never be possible without a degree. Alejandra was accepted into a degree program, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about financing her education. She plans on graduating in June 2016, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

With this loan, Alejandra plans on purchasing her much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Alejandra feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a career in business administration, she expects to earn $13 a day. 

Alejandra's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of 14, finances have always been stretched thin. With 11 older siblings, Alejandra is unsure how she will be able to afford her school books on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Alejandra's father's salary from his job as a mason is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo, tiene 59 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, cortes. Toda su vida ha sido agricultor, cultiva maíz, frijol, yuca y plátano. Donde realiza los cultivos es un terreno comunal, la producción la vende en el mercado local del municipio. El préstamo que solicita es por 7,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como fertilizantes y abonos para dar mejor asistencia a sus cultivos. Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder hacer su casa en un terreno propio que tiene ya que donde vive es de un familiar.
texts.en: Eduardo is 59 years old and married. He has two children and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. He has been a farmer for his whole life; he grows corn, beans, cassava, and bananas. He plants his crops in communal land and sells his produce at the local market. The loan he is requesting is for 7,000 HNL and he will invest it in the purchase of supplies, such as fertilizer and compost, in order to give his crops better care. His goal is to continue working in order to build his house on some land he has as he is currently living with relatives.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as fertilizer and compost, to better care for his crops

loans.name: Leonel

texts.en: Leonel lives in Saint Louis du Nord (Nordwest of Haiti).  He has one kid.  He is an entrepreneur who owns a little fast food restaurant and a barber shop.  He wants to grow his business by building a little store to sell cosmetic products and Eneji Pwop (EP) products.  He thinks selling EP products will allow him to do that since the Saint Louis community does not have access to electricity.  He will be selling Sunking Pro, Powapak, & Lanp Eneji Pwop.

loans.use: To buy a solar system from Eneji Pwop to sell in his little fast food restaurant.

loans.name: Servarius

texts.en:
This loan will help Servasius to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters, and clean cookstoves to his community.

Coming from a farming family, Servasius continued the family’s legacy despite dreaming of becoming a successful businessman.  It was only later that he decided to realize his aspiration by opening a store selling phone minutes, toiletries, and snacks.  

Today, he is the closest he has been to that dream by joining Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies.  He will use the loan to buy renewable energy products and grow his business.  

Servasius is very enthusiastic about the initiative and started spreading the word about cost-savings and health benefits of these products even before his first shipment arrived to sell.  And, with a big family of seven children, he could not be more excited about the possibilities that additional income from Tech Kiosk sales can bring.

loans.use: to buy some renewable energy products and grow his business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en: Maria Luisa is a hard working young woman. Until recently she was living with her parents saving all she could from the money she made as selling cosmetics and shoes from direct catalog sales. She had a plan to use all those saving to buy her own land and build a house, not something big, but something small that could grow when she started her own family. Maria Luisa saved enough to buy the land and start building but soon realized that her numbers were not accurate. She is still missing money to finish her house. For the last year she had to stop construction and now lives between her parents house and the unfinished house because she is afraid someone might think it is abandoned. Maria Luisa is still saving all she can but needs a loan to complete purchasing the materials and building her house. She makes around $500 a month through an informal job, so she has no access to credit from other institutions. With this loan Maria Luisa will be able to finish a life long dream and accomplish a huge achievement: having her own house. Maria Luisa will receive supervised visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Manrique Danilo

texts.es: Manrique de 27 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 4 años, 6 años y 9 años de edad. ÉL es un joven comprometido quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Manrique se dedica al comercio de ropa nueva para niño. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad y gracias a los buenos productos y precios que ofrece muchas personas la prefieren. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la venta y de esta forma mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Con el monto solicitado comprará pantalones, camisas, trajes, camisetas, etc.
texts.en: 27-year-old Manrique lives in his own house with his wife and his three children, who are aged four, six, and nine years. He is a committed young man who does everything in his power to give his family better living conditions. Manrique makes a living by selling new children’s clothes. He sells them on the streets of the main areas of his neighbourhood and many people prefer his business for the good products and prices he offers. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest it in the purchase of merchandise to sell, in this way improving his sales and his earnings. With the requested amount he will purchase pants, shirts, suits, t-shirts, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, suits, t-shirts, etc

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin dreams of becoming a systems engineer, but he knows that without a degree it may never be possible. To achieve his goal, Edwin has enrolled in the Universidad Domingo Savio. He plans on graduating in December 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

With this loan, Edwin plans to purchase his much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Edwin feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. 

With a degree in systems engineering, he expects to earn $15 a day. As the youngest of three, with one older sibling attending college already, Edwin is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for his school books.

loans.name: Ersilda Ivette

texts.es: Ersilda de 26 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 13 años. Ella es una joven muy trabajadora, comprometida y dedicada quien trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Todos los días trabaja como empleada de una institución cercana a su localidad y en su tiempo libre se dedica a atender su negocio de tienda la cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer en su lugar de residencia. De esta forma se gana la vida y apoya a su querida familia con la economía del hogar. Desea invertir en la compra de mercadería de tienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar mayor inventario como: golosinas, sopas, macarrones, papel de baño, detergente, etc.
texts.en: Ersilda is 26 years old, living with her family in their own home for the past 13 years. She is a very hard working young woman, committed and dedicated to working hard to get her family ahead. Every day she works as an employee for an institution close to her home. She dedicates her free time to tending to her store, which she established through great effort and runs out of her home. In this way she makes a living and supports her dear family's household expenses. She requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her store. She will buy inventory in bulk such as: sodas, soups, pastas, toilet paper and detergent.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, soups, pasta, toilet paper, detergent and other items.

loans.name: Juvencio

texts.es:
Juvencio tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el Anexo Catagua, una zona rural del distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad con clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo y venta de lima, desde hace 25 años, cuenta con clientela considerable, Juvencio ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento de su cultivo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juvencio is 64 years old and lives with his son in the Catagua Annex, a rural area in the district of San Felipe with a warm climate. Two hours from the city of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of the North Sierra of Peru, its people make a living from agriculture and commerce.

He has made a living by growing and selling limes for 25 years, and he has a considerable customer base. Juvencio has asked for a loan for 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy fertilizer to maintain his crop and thus generate greater earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his lime crop.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a coffee farmer in Rwamarembo where he has been since 2010. He is a hard-working man who works four days on the farm and eight hours per day worked on the farm. He started farming with an aim of earning income to cater for his personal needs and the needs of his family. In addition to farming,  Patrick has a butchery at a local trading centre in Kyamuhunga Bushenyi which boosts his income greatly. His clients are mostly people from Bushenyi and he believes these have really supported him greatly. 

Patrick plans to use the loan money of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more cows which he will slaughter and sell in kilograms of meat thereby earning a profit. Unfavourable weather is his major challenge but he believes it will cease to be if he gets a loan, makes a profit, and buys mulch  for the coffee plantation.

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughter

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba was born in 1961. She is married and has no children. Mahbuba has been busy growing potatoes and wheat for more than 13 years. She grows potatoes on her own land. She knows her deal very well and has great experience. Mahbuba has additional income from animal husbandry. She has a cowshed in her house. She feeds a milking cow. Mahbuba is going to start sowing again but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 2,300 USD to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and cattle to increase the number of her cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and cattle

loans.name: Aida Margot

texts.es:
Aida, se ha decidió por otro crédito para continuar trabando en su negocio de venta de pan y tamales, ella invertirá en la compra de leña por mayor.
El efecto que tuvo con el crédito anterior fue muy positivo, sus ventas aumentaron y los nuevos ingresos le han permitido iniciar su educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aida has decided to request another loan to continue working in her business selling bread and tamales. She will invest in buying firewood wholesale.

The effect she had with the previous loan was very positive; her sales increased and the new income has allowed her to start educating her children.

loans.use: to buy firewood wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина молодая и очень активная девушка. Она пока не замужем и живёт со своими родителями.  Живёт вместе со своими родителями в маленькой деревушке. С юного возрасте Нигина была предприимчивой и способной девушкой. Всегда находила себе занятие или работу, которая приносила ей прибыль, и она могла тратить денежные средства на свои нужды. На сегодня она самостоятельно ведёт свой бизнес, который приносит ей доход. Она продаёт товар, который состоит из разных сувениров, ручных поделок и игрушек. Поначалу у Нигины был маленький ассортимент товара, но постепенно она расширяла ассортимент своего товара. И на сегодня её бизнес успешен и приносит ей хороший доход. Благодаря своему стремлению и желанию работать, Нигина хочет расширить свой бизнес, но для этого своего капитала не хватает. Поэтому она решила обратится в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить партию сувениров для дальнейшей продажи. Нигина надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Nigina is an energetic young woman. She is unmarried and lives with her parents in a small village. Ever since she was young Nignia has been enterprising and capable, always keeping busy and working so that she could earn money to support herself. Today she runs her own business and earns money selling assorted souvenirs, handmade crafts, and small toys. At first she only had a small selection of goods, but she has been gradually expanding her inventory. She has a successful business and earns a good income. Because she is ambitious and wants to work, Nigina would like to expand her business. However, she does not have sufficient capital, so she decided to apply for a loan with Arvand to purchase a batch of souvenirs to sell. She hopes for positive results and thanks Arvand for the support.

loans.use: to buy souvenirs to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida dreams of owning and managing a hotel and restaurant business. At present, Zenaida has been running a retailing business for seven years. She specifically runs a variety store, selling grocery items like coffee, sugar, powdered milk and other goods for daily consumption. She is happily married with one kid. Zenaida will do her best to earn an income and hope to attain her dream soon.

Zenaida is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy toothpaste, shampoo, powdered soap, canned goods and noodles. She believes that through this loan, she can obtain her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, shampoo, powdered soap, canned goods, and noodles to re-stock her general store

loans.name: Nerio

texts.en: Nerio is a 43-year-old man from Panglao, Bohol. He has four children. His eldest is 22 and the youngest is 14. For fifteen years now, Nerio has been fishing to earn a living for his family. He requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy a fishing net, weighing scale and foam. Nerio would like to invest in other ventures to support his family's needs and at the same time save for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, weighing scale and foam.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a happier family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more fabric, thread and other materials for her business.

loans.name: 01.13.01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Vui operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells rice and noodles. She has been in business for five years.  

Vui is requesting a loan to purchase items needed to make processed food.  One of her most critical business difficulties is the lack of capital.

Vui is 54 years old and she is married with one children.  She is the group leader of the 01.13.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which includes three members. 

Vui lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.  This will be Vui's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  

Vui hopes to use her profit from her business loan to improve the health and happiness of her family and she hopes to help her children find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase items needed to make processed food.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, es casado, tiene dos hijas las cuales están estudiando, junto a sus padres aprendió a la crianza de pollos es por eso que hoy en día se dedica a administrar su granja de pollos, lo hace todos los días, como una forma de generar las ganancias con las cuales cubre los gastos de su hogar.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de concentrado y pollos, de esta manera tendrá fortalecido el negocio y podrá cumplir con la de manda de sus clientes, espera tener un  negocio muy competitivo para mejorar la economía familiar.
Sueña con cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia y mantener su negocio activo.
texts.en:
José is married and has two children who attend school.  He learned to raise chickens from his parents and currently makes a living running a chicken farm.  He works every day to generate the earnings to cover the household expenses.

José will invest the capital in concentrated feed and chickens to strengthen his business and meet customer demand.  He hopes to have a more competitive business to improve the family finances.

José dreams of changing his family's lifestyle and of keeping his business running.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and chickens

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Doña Evarista, tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortés con su conyugue y sus hijos. Tiene 4 años de tener un salón de belleza como su propio negocio, presta servicios de tintes, cortes de pelo, alisados, planchados, manicure, pedicure y otros. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y lo ha mantenido mediante la inversión de varios prestamos. Actualmente solicita otro por 21,000 Lempiras para comprar productos de belleza como tintes, champú, cremas, esmaltes, tratamientos para cabello, etc. Su sueño es lograr que su negocio sea auto sostenible.
texts.en: Evarista is 53 years old. She lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortés, with her partner and her children. For the past four years she has operated a beauty salon as her own business. She provides services such as hair coloring, haircuts, straightening, hair ironing, manicures, pedicures and others. She runs the business in her home, and she has maintained it by investing with various loans. Currently, she is requesting another one for 21,000 Lempiras, to buy beauty products such as hair dyes, shampoo, creams, nail polish, hair treatments, etc. Her dream is to reach the point where her business is self-sustaining.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business such as hair dyes, shampoo, creams, nail polish, hair treatments, etc.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 26-year-old man from Kakamega County. He is married to Pamela, who is a farmer in the same county. They have two children aged six and four, respectively.

He operates a retail shop, a business he has done for the last five years, and earns a monthly income of 25,000 KES.He is taking his first loan of 40,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya which he intends to use to expand his business and educate his children. 

The anticipated proceeds will be used to pay off the loan and add more share to VisionFund Kenya.

His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of sugar, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new camera to take more pictures.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en: Because Ameera is a conservative lady, she asked her mother to take her place in the picture. Ameera is a 21-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her three siblings and her parents. One of her brothers is in the military. Ameera is studying for a Bachelors’ majoring in International Relations and Strategic Studies. She is in her third year and she is planning to work in her field of study after that in order to start helping her family financially as they are currently facing financial crisis which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia de 45 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos de 21 años y 10 años de edad. Lidia se gana la vida mediante la elaboración y venta de yuca salcochada y yuca frita. La venta la realiza en su casa de habitación desde hace mucho tiempo y gracias a su carisma y deliciosa yuca que ofrece muchas personas la prefieren cada día más. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para ampliar su negocio ya que desea icursionar en el mercado de calzado, además del negocio de yuca. Con el monto solicitado comprará yuca al por mayor y zapatos para dama.
texts.en: Lidia ia 45 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own house together with her children, who are 21 and 10. Lidia earns her living by preparing and selling boiled and fried yuca. She has sold this product out of the house where she lives for a long time. Thanks to her charisma and the delicious yuca she offers, she attracts more customers each day. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to expand her business, since she would like to enter the market for shoes in addition to her yuca business. With the funds she is requesting, she will buy yuca on a wholesale basis as well as women's shoes.

loans.use: to buy yuca on a wholesale basis and women's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en: Sayora is 29 years old. She is married but has no children.  Sayora began her own business with selling milk 10 years ago. Then she changed her business. Sayora has been busy with sewing national women's dresses. Sayora sews wonderful women's dresses. Her relations and neighbors are her clients. Sayora wants to develop her business because her business is the main source of income of her family. For developing business, she needs a sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 1700 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is 27 years old and married with one child. They live in their own house in a rural area. Before one year ago, Mahdi and his partner opened a business for renting cars. Mahdi was working as a taxi driver and has good experience in the car servicing field. He has applied for this youth loan to renew the registration of the cars. Mahdi has a lot of customers who prefer to use his cars service since he drives attentively and very carefully. He hops that this business increases his income and he will be able to give his children good conditions for life and meet their needs.

loans.use: to renew the registration of the cars.

loans.name: J Leonidas

texts.es: Don Leonidas, tiene 51 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus dos hijos en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, hace 10 años aumento su producción de maíz y frijol y la vende en el mercado local. Cuenta con su propia parcela de terreno para cultivar. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con el propósito de mejorar la producción y ventas. Su plan es ampliar el cultivo, mejorar la cosecha y sus ganancias para darle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Leonidas is 51 years old and single. He lives with his two children in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. He has always worked in agriculture growing staple crops. Ten years ago, he increased his production of corn and beans, and he sells them at the local market. He has his own plot of land to cultivate. The loan he is requesting is for 15,000 Lempiras, to buy fertilizers for his corn and bean crops, in order to improve his production and sales. His plan is to expand his fields and improve his harvest and his earnings, in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to nourish his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 23-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her five brothers and her parents. Her father is a retired old man who currently works as a personal driver. She is studying for a Bachelors’ degree majoring in gymnastics education. She is in her 4th year and is one step closer to graduation. Sarah is planning to work in her field of study after that in order to start helping her family financially as they are currently facing financial crisis which is not allowing them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La Sra. Pamela es una mujer muy trabajadora vive en un departamento en anticretico en la zona de Bella Vista ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a la atencion de ventas en una empresa de fotocopiadoras, trabajo muy responsablemente. El esposo se separo hace ya mas de un año la dejo con un hijo. Ella va a su trabajo en la zona de central  de la ciudad desde las 9:00 de la manana hasta las 7 de la noche; Pamela necesita el credito para hacer refacciones al departamento que ella habita (arreglo en el baño y en un deormitorio) y asi poder tener mejor comodidad tanto para ella y su hijo de 2 años.

El sueño de Pamela poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace,  y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pamela is a very hard-working woman. She lives in an apartment under an "anticretico" [antichresis] arrangement, in the Bella Vista area of the city of La Paz.  She principally works as a salesperson for a photocopier business, and she is a very responsible worker. Her husband separated from her more than a year ago, leaving her with one child. She goes to work in the downtown area of the city from 9:00 in the morning to 7 in the evening. Pamela needs a loan to carry out repairs to the apartment where she lives (fixing up the bathroom and one bedroom). Thus she will be able to have greater comfort for herself and her 2-year-old son. 

Pamela's dream is to achieve a higher income based on the sacrifices she makes, and to be able to have a peaceful retirement. She hopes to receive a retirement pension which will allow her to live with an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to repair her bathroom and one bedroom.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dinora, opta por un nuevo crédito para fortalecer su negocio, en esta oportunidad comprara ropa, artículos plásticos y granos básicos, con los que mantendrá activo y bien surtido su inventario.
El capital anterior le ayudo a comprar mercadería necesaria para mantener satisfechos a sus clientes, ha mejorado su economía, cancelo sus deudas y las circunstancias familiares han cambiado. Ha includido otro tipo de productos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dinora has applied for a new loan to strengthen her business. This time she will buy clothing, plastic items and basic food staples which will allow her to stay open with a well-stocked inventory. 

A previous loan helped her buy necessary merchandise to keep her customers satisfied. She has improved her finances, paid off her debts, and her family situation has changed. She has also added other types of products to her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, plastic goods and basic food staples.

loans.name: Jully Tatiana

texts.es:
Ella es jully, cuyo sueño es ayudar es poder brindar una ayuda a la comunidad y por que no avances científicos por medio de sus habilidades y conocimientos, pero ella tiene un impedimento para avanzar a gran escala, su impedimento es el recurso económico. 
Vive con su mama, hermano menor, abuela y dos tíos, donde solo su mama es quien responde por ellos con tan solo un mínimo autorizado en su país.
A su corta edad tiene grandes aspiraciones y la lucha por los sueños comenzó en diciembre cuando una llamada entro a su teléfono ofreciendo un programa educativo que seria el primer escalón a el sueño.
Actualmente estudia auxiliar de enfermería, la formación con las ciencias de la salud la ha impulsado a no bajar la guardia frente a la situación económica y a si terminar los primeros estudios, pero para la mala suerte, el convenio con el que la financiaron para el estudios se dio por terminado y sin el no podría continuar por mas que la inspiración y motivación la impulsen, por eso hoy a querido vincularse a la gran oportunidad de ser parte  del convenio con kiva, seria esta la solución para poder tener una base educativa y en la sociedad avanzando, para dentro de unos años brindar esa ayuda que tanto desea brindar a la familia que la ha apoyado y a la comunidad que necesita de gente dispuesta a luchar por ellos mismos y por quienes lo rodean.
texts.en:
This is Jully, whose dream is to be able to help the community. Through her ability and knowledge she is making progress in science, but her lack of economic resources is an impediment that prevents her from advancing to a higher level. 

She lives with her mother, younger brother, grandmother, and two uncles; her mother has sole responsibility for them, with only the minimum allowable in her country.  

At her young age, she has great aspirations, and her fight for her dreams began in December when she received a phone call, offering an educational program that would become the first step toward her dream.

She is currently studying to be a nursing assistant, and the health sciences training program has motivated her to not give in to her economic situation, and to complete the first level of her studies.  But as bad luck would have it, the partnership through which she was financed was terminated, and without it she could not continue, however much inspiration and motivation drove her.  That is why she wants to take the great opportunity to be part of the Kiva partnership today.

It would be the solution that would enable her to have an educational foundation and to progress in society.  This way, within a few years she will be able to give her family, who has supported her, the help that she wants so much to give them, and she will be able to help the community, which needs people who want to fight for themselves and for those around them.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Nueva Vision Group

texts.es: Maria Isabel 40 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos el mayor de 21 años y el ultimo de 14. Junto su esposo trabajan para brindarles a sus hijos estabilidad económica. María Isabel es secretaria del grupo “NUEVA VISIÓN” conformado por 06 socios. Ella es docente  de profesión, tiene una librería negocio que empezó porque ella era consumidora de ese tipo artículos, el negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio donde trabaja aproximadamente 07 horas diarias, su negocio ofrece toda clase de materiales de librería y oficina, por otro lado también dicta clases particulares generándole otros ingresos. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá mejorar su negocio y comprar artículos de librería. En el futuro le gustaría que su negocio siga creciendo. El grupo esta agradecido por este préstamo a los inversionistas que lo hacen posible, Maria Isabel es la segunda de la izquierda (sentada)viste polo blanco.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 40 years old and has two children: the eldest is 21 years old and the younger one is 14. Together with her husband, she works to provide economic stability for her children. María Isabel is the secretary of the “NUEVA VISIÓN” ["New Vision"] group, which is composed of 6 members. She is a teacher by profession, and she has a bookstore business which she started because she was a consumer of this type of goods. The business is located in her home, where she works approximately 7 hours per day. Her business offers every type of paper goods and office supplies. She also gives private classes, which generate additional income for her. With the loan she is requesting, she will be able to improve her business and buy bookstore supplies. In the future, she would like to see her business keep growing. The group is grateful for this loan and the investors who make it possible. Maria Isabel is the second from the left (seated) in a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her bookstore.

loans.name: Alma Sixtina

texts.es:
Alma es una joven de 30 años de edad graduada de bachiller en ciencias y letras, casada con el que hasta hoy en día es su esposo el cual es agricultor madre de 2 hijos la mayor tiene 10 años de edad quien el próximo año va a quinto grado en la escuela de la comunidad. En compañía de su esposo trabajan la agricultura involucrándose únicamente ellos 2 que además ella trabaja como maestra voluntaria en el kínder de su comunidad el cual está frente a su casa, ahora tienen otra niña la cual tiene tres meses de nacida y viven al lado de la casa de sus padres. Su ingreso económico depende del cultivo de café rubro al que se dedica desde hace 5 años aprendiendo de sus padres y en compañía de su esposo. Además de que ella había tenido una inducción en el colegio sobre el cultivo de café lo cual le pareció muy importante y lo ha estado poniendo en práctica ya en lo propio y junto a su esposo por lo cual ella puede realizar todas las tareas concernientes al cultivo del café. El terreno que trabajan es propio el cual lo adquirieron gracias a una herencia y la otra parte fueron una compra por lo que agradecen a Dios por ser tierras productoras de café ubicadas a 10 minutos de su casa de habitación a la cual se dirigen en moto o carro. Ella últimamente no se ha involucrado mucho en el cuidado y mantenimiento por el embarazo y cuidado de su hija menor.
Sus metas, planes y sueños mantener sus cultivos de café en excelentes condiciones, comprar más tierra para cultivarlo de café en una mejor variedad y de esa manera asegurar y darle un nivel de vida a su familia mucho mejor sobre todo sus hijas quienes quisiera que se prepararan con una carrera universitaria y que encuentren un buen trabajo para que tengan otros ingresos. 
Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado financiamiento el cual invertirá en podar una parte de su plantación que esta vieja para que retoñe plata nueva, abonar, foliar y pagar mano de obra para darle mantenimiento a la misma.
texts.en:
Alma is a young woman, 30 years old, graduated from high school in science and letters. She is married with he who, today, is her husband, who is a farmer. She is a mother of two children, the eldest is 10 and, next year will go to fifth grade in the community school. With the company of her husband they farm, involving only themselves. In addition, she works as a volunteer teacher in the kindergarten of her community, which is in front of her house. Right now, they have another daughter who is three months old and they live next to the house of her parents. Her economic income depends on the coffee plants, work that she has been doing for the past five years, learning from her parents and in the company of her husband.

Also, she has participated in the school about coffee cultivation, which was seemed very important to her and she has been putting it to practice already by itself and alongside her husband. Therefore, she can carry out all of the tasks concerned with coffee cultivation. The land that they work is their own, which they acquired thanks to inheritance. The other part was purchased for which they thank God for being lands which produce coffee. They are located 10 minutes from their house, to which they drive in a motorcycle or car. Lately, she has not been involved much in the care and maintenance because of the pregnancy and care of her youngest daughter.

Her goals, plans and dreams are to maintain her coffee plants in excellent conditions and buy more land to grow coffee in a better variety. In this manner, she will assure and give a much better level of life to her family, above all her daughters, whom she wishes to prepare with a university career and wishes that they find good work so that they have other income.

Because of this, these days she has applied for financing, which she will invest in pruning a part of her crop that is old so that she can get more money, fertilize, foliate and pay labor to give maintenance to said crop.

loans.use: for assistance and purchase of agricultural supplies for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would now like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a better living. She attends the fellowship* every week for the teachings.  Sharing the word of God continues to enlighten and uplift her spirit. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Amer is the sole provider of his family.
Amer owns a shop where he sells video games for PCs and PlayStations. He also sells accessories, such as microphones and speakers. Amer has been practicing this business since 2007 and has good experience in this field. He has a hired employee and has gained an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Amer is applying for a loan of 3,000 USD in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar telas, botones, zippers, y reparar la máquina de coser, de esta manera  continuara trabajando sin ningún problema.
Para María fue de mucha ayuda el préstamo anterior ya que pudo contar con los materiales necesarios para que su sastrería creciera y ofreciera un mejor servicio, su clientela ha aumentado, la economía a mejorado y su familia se encuentra en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan to buy fabric, buttons and zippers, and to repair her sewing machine. In this way she will continue working without any problems.

For María the previous loan was lot of help, as she was able to have the materials necessary for her tailoring workshop to grow and to offer a better service. Her customer base has increased, the economy has improved and her family is in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons and zippers, and to repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Djalal

texts.en:
Djalal was born in Xodjavand city in 1972.  However, for 21 years his motherland has been occupied by Armenians and Djalal’s family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons). Djalal is married and father of two children. They live in Abseron region. One of his children is 16, he is in the tenth class of school and preparing to go to University. His other child, a daughter, goes to music college. She is a very talented girl, plays the piano and in the future wants to be a famous musician. His wife is a housewife and Djalal is a taxi driver. He transports passengers between various locations in Abseron region.

 Djalal is a hardworking man and loves his job. Now he needs a loan in the amount of 1200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). It’s his third loan. Djalal applied to Komak company. With this loan he wants to buy winter tires. Djalal is thankfull to Kiva and its lenders for their help. In the future he wants to repair cars.

loans.use: to buy winter tires

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, solicita un crédito nuevo para la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), sus labores inician a las 6:00 a.m., en está ocasión pagara la mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha, es un oficio que heredo de su familia y lo ayudan sus hijos. La tienda que poseía antes ya no está activa, sin embargo la venta de electrodomésticos de forma ambulante si lo sigue realizando.
El préstamo anterior en su momento le ayudo a surtir la tienda, lo que le sirvió para tener mejores ganancias y pudo cancelar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Luis is requesting another loan for growing basic grains (corn and beans).  He starts work at 6 a.m.

This time Luis will pay laborers to harvest the crop.  It's a line of work he learned from his family, and his children help him.  The store he used to have is no longer in business, but he's still selling appliances as a street vendor.

The previous loan helped him stock his store at the time.  This helped him have better earnings, and he was able to pay back his debt.

loans.use: to pay laborers to harvest the crop

loans.name: Ravshanoy

texts.en: Ravshanoy was born in year 1975. She is divorced. Ravshanoy has a child. Ravshanoy grows wheat and potatoes. She has been busy with animal husbandry also. Ravshanoy is the only breadwinner in her family. From the profit of her business, she made a wedding party of her son last year. Now, she has no savings to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to sow wheat and potatoes. She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni (TJS) with this aim. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to sow wheat and potatoes.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.en:
Adolfo is a 64-year-old man from Maribojoc, Bohol. He is married and has been engaging in fish vending business for five years now. He sells fresh fish in his community, which earns him 15,000 PHP per month. He is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy fresh fish, weighing scale, and pail. This will allow him to work better and easier with new equipment. His income provides food for his family and pay for household bills, such as electricity.

Adolfo hopes to earn better and save more for his future needs.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, weighing scale, and pail.

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is a 30-year-old man from the town of Loboc, Bohol. He is a hard-working man who is engaged in raising hogs and providing transportation service with his motorcycle (habal-habal) for five years now.

Romel wants to expand his business and is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed and tires. Romel hopes that he will be able to sustain and continue to improve his business to better prepare his future.

He plans to expand his business and make it bigger for increased profitability.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and tires

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe previously accessed a loan of 50,000 PHP that she used to purchase more vegetables and varieties of fish needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store and a food stall for additional income.
 
Cleofe would like to apply for another loan of 35,000 PHP to buy more vegetables and varieties of fish needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cleofe dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables and varieties of fish needed in her business

loans.name: Saipa

texts.en:
This is Saipa, 36, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Eliyas, a vendor, and a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Saipa runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of something. In Yolanda’s case, she is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are very much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. Since her stall is located in an urban poor public market, her business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help her expand the business, she is requesting for a Php 25,000 loan to buy additional stock of used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, also used bags and footwear. If she can roll over the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Saipa dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of used-but-quality clothes.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials, such as fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials, such as fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Florencia hopes to have other sources of income and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a farmer in the Bugomola local cell in Bushenyi district. He is a father of one child aged sixteen years, and he also looks after the mother who is the only dependent in his house. 

He has been a cattle farmer since 1993. This is a business that he started with the objective of earning an income to support his family. Farming is his major source of income. He also involved in money lending as a way of earning more income to support his family. His clients are farmers and butchers from the same area where he does business. 

He is very hopeful that if the business is boosted by restocking using the loan money of 2,500,000 UGX, it will do well and earn him enough profits. He will then invest the profits back into the business. His future plan is to expand the business from one level to another. 

Inadequate pastures are the main challenge he is facing at the moment since the land he has is not enough for grazing his cows. He believes that this problem will be solved if he earns enough profits and then buys another piece of land for grazing the cows.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a single Iraqi youth client, who is 28 years old and lives with his family composed of seven members, of whom four are employed and share in supporting the family together.

Mouhammad owns a shop where he sells kitchenware like plates, cups, pans and teapots. He established his business in 2012 and has gained much experience in this field. He now has two hired employees and has gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.
