Mouhammad is requesting a youth loan of 1,800 USD so he may renovate his shop by installing ceramic blocks on the walls of his shop. Mouhammad is aiming to continue to grow in this field and expand his business in the future so he may provide a better income.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing ceramic blocks on the walls of his shop

loans.name: Nadutari

texts.en:
Nadutari is 33 years old, married to Tilal and blessed with eight children whom she supports. She is a mixed crop farmer in Narok County and has been farming for the last ten years. Her monthly income is 20,000 KES.

Nadutari has applied for a sixth loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. It will be used to purchase farm inputs for better crop yields and also to hire a tractor for land preparation.

The anticipated profits will be used to support the business. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and also to hire a tractor for land preparation

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items that she needed in her variety store. Her loan helped not just her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is helping to pay for their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Jane hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Montaña Camapara Group

texts.es:
Don Natividad, tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una aldea de Gracias, Lempira. El cultiva café, vende el grano en uva en la misma zona y también cultiva maíz y frijoles. Toda su vida ha sido agricultor siendo su única fuente de ingresos para el sustento familiar. Solicita un préstamo por 4,000 Lempiras en forma grupal para comprar 8 bolsas de fertilizantes para sus cultivos y sacar mejor producción y ganancias. Su plan es seguir cultivando café para obtener ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y darles estudio a sus hijos. 
El Grupo se llama Montaña Camapara,esta integrado por 7 miembros, que se dedican al cultivo de café, maíz y frijol y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo que solicitan es de 23,000 lempiras y lo invertirán en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para dar asistencia a los cultivos. En la foto se identifican asi: a la izquierda esta Serbando, seguido esta Don Natividad, Antonio, José, Ismael, María y María Suyapa a la derecha.
texts.en:
Natividad is 54 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in a village in Gracias, Lempira. He grows coffee, and sells the coffee cherries in the same area. He also grows corn and beans.

Natividad has been a farmer his whole life, and this is his only source of income to support his family. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 lempiras as part of his group, in order to buy eight bags of fertilizers for his crops, and improve his production and profits. His plan is to continue growing coffee in order to earn an income, increase his quality of life, and provide his children with an education.

The group is called Montaña Campara and is composed of seven members. The members work growing coffee, corn and beans, and live in the same community. They are requesting a loan of 23,000 lempiras and will invest it the purchase of manure and fertilizers to help the growth of their crops. In the photo, the members are as follows: Serbando is on the left, followed by Natividad, Antonio, José, Ismael, María, and María Suyapa on the right.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to help grow his crops.

loans.name: Segundo Noe

texts.es:
Segundo vive en el distrito de San juan de Lurigancho, cada día trabaja en su pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de bolsas, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder llevar un sustento para su familia, sobre todo porque es padre de 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años a los cuales quiere mucho.

Segundo está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas para poder realizar su trabajo como una pequeña remalladora, sellador, entre otros, así podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y poder tener otro negocio”.
texts.en:
Segundo lives in the San Juan de Lurigancho district.  He works every day in his small business making and selling bags, which enables him to support his family.  He's the father of two children, ages 8 and 5, and he loves them very much.

Segundo's grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy tools to do his job, including a small darner and sealant.

This way he'll be able to continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of giving his children a profession and being able to have another business.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Because Zainab is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. Zainab was born in 1971. She is married and a mother of six living in a sector of Jordan called Baqaa. Her husband is a driver. 

Leen, one of Zainab's daughters, is a 20-year-old woman studying for her bachelor's degree in Mechatronics Engineering. She is in her third year and is planning to work in her study field to financially help her family. The family is currently facing a financial crisis which makes them unable to pay for her upcoming semester fees. 

Because of the family's financial crisis, Zainab has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Hania

texts.en:
Hania is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan is helpful not just for her business, but also for the education of her children. Her income from the business helps pay for their everyday household expenditures. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Hania hopes to expand her business and have more customers. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her general store business.
